commit_message:
zuul: Stop testing against Tempest

Neither Tempest itself nor any of the service projects use OSC. As such,
there's no reason to run Tempest jobs here. It's simply a waste of
resources.

Change-Id: I74b0b196fe59e5e1462e3dadc659cf6680a53f80
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-10-06 03:41:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove six

Change-Id: I9bd4886ebe05f920c4a23d0f4ffe5878aeacb92c
'}, {'created': '2020-10-06 07:32:02.000000000', 'message': "Remove six

With python3.x, classes can use 'metaclass=' instead of
'six.add_metaclass', 'six.iteritems' and 'six.iterkeys' can
be replaced by 'items' and 'keys', 'six.moves.urllib.parse'
can be replaced by 'urllib.parse', 'six.StringIO' and
'six.moves.cStringIO' can be replaced by 'io.StringIO',
'six.text_type' and 'six.string_type' are just 'str'.

Change-Id: I9bd4886ebe05f920c4a23d0f4ffe5878aeacb92c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove six

With python3.x, classes can use 'metaclass=' instead of
'six.add_metaclass', 'six.iteritems' and 'six.iterkeys' can
be replaced by 'items' and 'keys', 'six.moves.urllib.parse'
can be replaced by 'urllib.parse', 'six.StringIO' and
'six.moves.cStringIO' can be replaced by 'io.StringIO',
'six.text_type' and 'six.string_type' are just 'str'.

Change-Id: I9bd4886ebe05f920c4a23d0f4ffe5878aeacb92c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-12 23:55:45.000000000', 'message': 'Recover scenario settings in openstack_auth test_auth

The scenario configuration in openstack_auth test_auth was ignored
somehow. Perhaps it happened when openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repo as test runners used in the horizon repo so far
(django test runner, nose and pytest) do not support testscenarios.

This commit tries to recover the original intention of the scenario.
pytest supports several ways to parametrize tests [1]
but there seems no way without changing each test functions.
A quick port of "testscenarios" is explained [2],
but it is just a way to generate tests based on scenarios and
we still need to add scenario parameters to each test function,
so we cannot refer scenario parameters in setUp().
As a result, I chose a way to inherit the original class and
pass different attributes per scenario.
This is not ideal and I hope pytest lovers can improve the situation.

[1] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html
[2] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html#a-quick-port-of-testscenarios

Change-Id: I1538ffbc853a2c9328c364f462a27be36c85cc2f
'}, {'created': '2020-09-12 23:58:43.000000000', 'message': 'Recover scenario settings in openstack_auth test_auth

The scenario configuration in openstack_auth test_auth was ignored
somehow. Perhaps it happened when openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repo as test runners used in the horizon repo so far
(django test runner, nose and pytest) do not support testscenarios.

This commit tries to recover the original intention of the scenario.
pytest supports several ways to parametrize tests [1]
but there seems no way without changing each test functions.
A quick port of "testscenarios" is explained [2],
but it is just a way to generate tests based on scenarios and
we still need to add scenario parameters to each test function,
so we cannot refer scenario parameters in setUp().
As a result, I chose a way to inherit the original class and
pass different attributes per scenario.
This is not ideal and I hope pytest lovers can improve the situation.

The test classes in test_auth are renamed to more meaningful ones.

Direct overrides of settings in test_auth.py are improved too.

[1] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html
[2] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html#a-quick-port-of-testscenarios

Change-Id: I1538ffbc853a2c9328c364f462a27be36c85cc2f
'}, {'created': '2020-10-27 10:58:30.000000000', 'message': 'Recover scenario settings in openstack_auth test_auth

The scenario configuration in openstack_auth test_auth was ignored
somehow. Perhaps it happened when openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repo as test runners used in the horizon repo so far
(django test runner, nose and pytest) do not support testscenarios.

This commit tries to recover the original intention of the scenario.
pytest supports several ways to parametrize tests [1]
but there seems no way without changing each test functions.
A quick port of "testscenarios" is explained [2],

we still need to add scenario parameters to each test function,
so we cannot refer scenario parameters in setUp().
As a result, I chose a way to inherit the original class and
pass different attributes per scenario.
This is not ideal and I hope pytest lovers can improve the situation.

The test classes in test_auth are renamed to more meaningful ones.

Direct overrides of settings in test_auth.py are improved too.

[1] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html
[2] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html#a-quick-port-of-testscenarios

Change-Id: I1538ffbc853a2c9328c364f462a27be36c85cc2f
'}]
commit_message:
Recover scenario settings in openstack_auth test_auth

The scenario configuration in openstack_auth test_auth was ignored
somehow. Perhaps it happened when openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repo as test runners used in the horizon repo so far
(django test runner, nose and pytest) do not support testscenarios.

This commit tries to recover the original intention of the scenario.
pytest supports several ways to parametrize tests [1]
but there seems no way without changing each test functions.
A quick port of "testscenarios" is explained [2],
but it is just a way to generate tests based on scenarios and
we still need to add scenario parameters to each test function,
so we cannot refer scenario parameters in setUp().
As a result, I chose a way to inherit the original class and
pass different attributes per scenario.
This is not ideal and I hope pytest lovers can improve the situation.

The test classes in test_auth are renamed to more meaningful ones.

Direct overrides of settings in test_auth.py are improved too.

[1] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html
[2] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html#a-quick-port-of-testscenarios

Change-Id: I1538ffbc853a2c9328c364f462a27be36c85cc2f

commit_message:
[part 1] remove six.py

The Python 2.7 Support has been dropped since Ussuri.
So remove hacking rules for compatibility between python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I807ecf358c96c1b47bd7fe63b3f5baf2ec6caac3

commit_message:
Expose --ansible-forks

Ansible forks are now configurable for a deployment. The default
will also no longer exceed 100 forks (but --ansible-forks can).

Conflicts:
    tripleoclient/v1/tripleo_deploy.py

Change-Id: Iaa6763a3124e45c1f0297cd59cc57f206dfc5cda
Depends-On: I57345d5b100efce143fa940b56c81f5e6bc6c390
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 896a397b1eaf0c49a5e4d15f399388a422adc939)

for the initial non-containerized undercloud to containerized
undercloud.

commit_message:
Remove install unnecessary packages

The docs requirements migrated to doc/requirements.txt
we need not install things from requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I8a7f47c699a574bc31931831b5f4714866b92bbb

commit_message:
Limit monasca-persister legacy jobs to stable

monasca-persister Java implementation has been deprecated. We stop
building and publishing Java binary with Ussuri and do it only on stable
branches.

Change-Id: I9dd155227b1f4d35da8cbb09e99141758360d9ed

subject: users: Fix password error reporting on user create/update
messages: [{'account_id': 31241, 'date': '2020-10-29 09:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-10-29 10:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-29 09:00:59.000000000', 'message': 'users: Fix password error reporting on user create/update

Fixed these:

- When changing a user password, if the password requirements had LFs in
  them, they would not be shown.

- When changing a password and the requirements were not met, the window
  was closed.

- When creating a user and the password does not meet requirements, it
  would simply say "Unable to create user." and close the window.

- When checking the logs, these errors would be not be shown.

Change-Id: I6a97b7af581c9bcb301fd7f023c203df33e44e62
Closes-Bug: #1897253
'}]
commit_message:
users: Fix password error reporting on user create/update

Fixed these:

- When changing a user password, if the password requirements had LFs in
  them, they would not be shown.

- When changing a password and the requirements were not met, the window
  was closed.

- When creating a user and the password does not meet requirements, it
  would simply say "Unable to create user." and close the window.

- When checking the logs, these errors would be not be shown.

Change-Id: I6a97b7af581c9bcb301fd7f023c203df33e44e62
Closes-Bug: #1897253

commit_message:
migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

keeping few jobs running on bionic nodeset till
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008185 is fixed
otherwise base devstack jobs switching to Focal will block
the gate.

Change-Id: I1106c5c2b400e7db899959550eb1dc92577b319d
Story: #2007865
Task: #40188

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-22 08:35:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix permission denied during Fernet key rotation

During a deploy, if keystone Fernet key rotation happens before the
keystone container starts, the rotation may fail with 'permission
denied'. This happens because config.json for Keystone sets the
permissions for /etc/keystone/fernet-keys.

This change fixes the issue by also setting the permissions for
/etc/keystone/fernet-keys in config.json for keystone-fernet and
keystone-ssh.

Change-Id: I561e4171d14dcaad8a2a9a36ccab84a670daa904
Closes-Bug: #1888512
"}]
commit_message:
Fix permission denied during Fernet key rotation

During a deploy, if keystone Fernet key rotation happens before the
keystone container starts, the rotation may fail with 'permission
denied'. This happens because config.json for Keystone sets the
permissions for /etc/keystone/fernet-keys.

This change fixes the issue by also setting the permissions for
/etc/keystone/fernet-keys in config.json for keystone-fernet and
keystone-ssh.

Change-Id: I561e4171d14dcaad8a2a9a36ccab84a670daa904
Closes-Bug: #1888512

commit_message:
Use centos as base element for dib images

At the moment, it's not possible to use diskimage-builder to
create images based on centos-minimal on ubuntu focal.
To be able to use ubuntu focal as nodeset, we start using
the centos dib element.

Change-Id: Ibe363729038da92c630c4d8c4deedb2507515999

On fpga program, we will download a bitstream file from glance
to a tmp local file. And no matter driver.program is success
or failed, the tmp local file should be removed

Change-Id: Ic7be96f3f6da9cf366224401bc330485e67fedf1
Signed-off-by: guolei <guolei_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>

commit_message:
Remove tmp bitstream file always

On fpga program, we will download a bitstream file from glance
to a tmp local file. And no matter driver.program is success
or failed, the tmp local file should be removed

Change-Id: Ic7be96f3f6da9cf366224401bc330485e67fedf1
Signed-off-by: guolei <guolei_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>

[{'created': '2020-09-24 22:06:15.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Simplify connection creation logic

It's a bit cleaner to have the API classes define their own factory
methods instead of having so many if statements in get_connection().

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 08:45:54.000000000', 'message': 'Check VM's console log before trying to SSH to it.

Due to issue described in related bug report, it seems that it may
happen sometimes that tempest will start trying to ssh to the instance
before ssh key will be really configured in the instance and in such
case it may happened that there will be AuthenticationFailure error
always there. Even if ssh key will be configured properly later during
the test.

To workaround that issue and avoid failures of tests, this patch adds
check if the vm is really booted and ready to ssh. It is done by
checking console log of the VM and looking for specific string "login:"
which appears at least in case of Cirros and Ubuntu images used in our
CI jobs.
In case when such string will not be found, test will continue to run
and will still try to ssh to the instance. So in worst case it may slow
ssh to the instance a bit but shouldn't really have any bad impact on
test as before this patch it would probably also wait similar amount of
time but on trying to SSH to the instance.

Change-Id: I8739f17ec8b05405056fd21f59817de60af12dd8
Related-Bug: #1892861

commit_message:
Check VM's console log before trying to SSH to it.

Due to issue described in related bug report, it seems that it may
happen sometimes that tempest will start trying to ssh to the instance
before ssh key will be really configured in the instance and in such
case it may happened that there will be AuthenticationFailure error
always there. Even if ssh key will be configured properly later during
the test.

To workaround that issue and avoid failures of tests, this patch adds
check if the vm is really booted and ready to ssh. It is done by
checking console log of the VM and looking for specific string "login:"
which appears at least in case of Cirros and Ubuntu images used in our
CI jobs.
In case when such string will not be found, test will continue to run
and will still try to ssh to the instance. So in worst case it may slow
ssh to the instance a bit but shouldn't really have any bad impact on
test as before this patch it would probably also wait similar amount of
time but on trying to SSH to the instance.

Change-Id: I8739f17ec8b05405056fd21f59817de60af12dd8
Related-Bug: #1892861

runtimes for wallaby.

commit_message:
Get rid of service start/stop sleep

Not that the NovaServiceManager is a thing and it's a bit more smart
about starting and stopping Nova services, we can get rid of the
time.sleep() hax.

Change-Id: I840882677ed141c82cd86859c6e2a42372e90fd7

subject: Revert updating version of pymemcache
messages:
[{'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-10-28 10:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-28 10:44:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can't we simply black list this version directly in tooz as it was already did for 1.3.0?

https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/src/branch/master/setup.cfg#L67

I don't think we want to decrease the version like that.

Also we could ignore this version by using our global-requirements:

https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/branch/master/global-requirements.txt#L206"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-28 12:08:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-28 12:10:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We should get it blacklisted too. The next release will raise the upper constraints again. Users should nearly always get that new version, but making sure we block the bad version will ensure no one ends up with it through some dependency constraint combination.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-10-28 13:08:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hervé, Sean, if you prefer I can convert this change to a blacklist in global-requirements, but I'm not sure this will block tests that use uppper-constraints, so we probably want both ?
Also I'm totally ok in blacklisting that in tooz, but I spoke with people from oslo and they are going to have a look, so probably there will be a fix soon-ish, which I guess will be valid for the next version of pymemcache as well.
We need this mainly to raise awareness and unlock our CI as currently we're excluding pymemcache 3.4.0 in a non-ortodox way :)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-28 13:22:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Blacklisting in global-requirements should prevent any projects from using it. So if you can update this patch, I think that would be best."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-10-28 13:36:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

will do, thanks! :)"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-10-28 13:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-28 13:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-28 13:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Revert updating version of pymemcache

The latest version of pymemcache (3.4.0) breaks the tooz memcache
driver effectively breaking all the projects that rely on that.
An example is provided by the ironic-inspector-tempest-managed-non-standalone
job in the ironic-inspector project where we had to force the
pymemcache version to be installed to 3.3.0
With this patch we set the version of pymemcache in upper-constraints
back to 3.3.0 and we blacklist version 3.4.0 in global-requirements
to prevent the use globally.

Change-Id: I155024516774949d9438d4f0b918f023eebcc6fc

subject: Add a new parameter to enable/disable bootstrap
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-10-21 00:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-10-21 02:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-10-21 07:45:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think this is fine, I'm just wondering why one would not want to run keystone-manage bootstrap multiple times, the keystone team assures that the tool is idempotent."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-10-21 07:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(its also only executed if something changes i.e config or db)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-10-21 08:29:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm just wondering why one would not want to run keystone-manage bootstrap multiple times, the keystone team assures that the tool is idempotent.

Yeah I think we can execute the bootstrap command repeatedly, but one concern with executing the bootstrap on multiple nodes is that it might cause some conflicts if the bootstrap command is executed on some nodes at the same time.

Actually in TripleO there was some consideration to avoid concurrent execution of database sync commands with symc_db parameter, and I think it still makes sense to provide the interface to enable/disable db operation to makes sure that the operation is executed only one of the multiple nodes."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-10-21 15:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-10-29 01:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 00:34:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new parameter to enable/disable bootstrap

This change introduces a new parameter to enable/disable bootstrap
command by the keystone::bootstrap command. This parameter is useful
expecially in the deployment with multiple controller nodes, and we
can run bootstrap command on only one of the controller nodes while
we generate puppet.conf on all controller nodes, so that we can use
openstack providers in all controller nodes.

Change-Id: If049e33fefc2681d2f4340f5910402b07e6e286f
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new parameter to enable/disable bootstrap

This change introduces a new parameter to enable/disable bootstrap
command by the keystone::bootstrap command. This parameter is useful
expecially in the deployment with multiple controller nodes, and we
can run bootstrap command on only one of the controller nodes while
we generate puppet.conf on all controller nodes, so that we can use
openstack providers in all controller nodes.

Change-Id: If049e33fefc2681d2f4340f5910402b07e6e286f

commit_message:
Minor fixes and improvements

Looking to eliminate FT errors

* objects:
  - drop redundant __import__
  - VnfLcmSubscription: fix typo (operationTypese -> operationTypes)
  - VnfDeploymentFlavour: set default instantiation_levels to empty list
* tacker-conductor-server:
  - fix logging error
  - fix missing vnfc resource updating on vnf respawn via SOL003-style
    Heal API call
* FT codebase:
  - VnfPackageTest: set total sizes to its real full size
  - Keystone: introduce client initialization retry
* tosca/utils:
  - fix a python3 issue
* plugins:
  - fenix: avoid an erroneous heat API call

Change-Id: I218cb0f176762d766fad5fd1f60fdfa3da628f25

commit_message:
Force CephAnsiblePlaybook to its default value on FFU prepare

There is code in tripleo-ansible [1] which will look at if user
customized the CephAnsiblePlaybook to run and, if so, will always
use that instead of the special playbook we intend to use on
_systemd or _fstobs tags.

This change will reset param value to its default on FFU
prepare so that we actually trigger the special playbooks later
on in the process, whichever custom setting operators might
have set via CephAnsiblePlaybook param for their Queens deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1898589

1. https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_run_ansible/tasks/main.yml#L19

Change-Id: If3c0e12181bb926125eb8aa1014db35ed111ca35
(cherry picked from commit aafb509618b1c181b5eb373fabe510cad9ba8c8b)

[{'created': '2020-09-17 16:24:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I20e3db3b092462c85d784aad51d5e98f3499f3f1

messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-10-21 09:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-10-21 15:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-10-29 01:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 09:41:48.000000000', 'message': 'New class to support keystone_auth config

The config section [keystone_auth] is used for service user, which is
different from [keystone_authtoken]. They used to be managed in the same
class, but after the deprecation in Change
I0cea57dd58b4ddc532ee28a045ec4b75b8312919, magnum can no longer fall
back to use the values in keystone_authtoken/admin_user [1]

We add a new class to manage [keystone_auth] of the config, to keep it
distinct from keystone_authtoken

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/stable/train/magnum/common/keystone.py#L122-L123

Closes-Bug: #1900813
Change-Id: Ib1fe977a151346cd2ab29ad33d7d9dbb86413fe6
(cherry picked from commit 85b20b0db469a6a0777192a7f94ea454b9d1cce8)
'}]
commit_message:
New class to support keystone_auth config

The config section [keystone_auth] is used for service user, which is
different from [keystone_authtoken]. They used to be managed in the same
class, but after the deprecation in Change
I0cea57dd58b4ddc532ee28a045ec4b75b8312919, magnum can no longer fall
back to use the values in keystone_authtoken/admin_user [1]

We add a new class to manage [keystone_auth] of the config, to keep it
distinct from keystone_authtoken

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/stable/train/magnum/common/keystone.py#L122-L123

Closes-Bug: #1900813
Change-Id: Ib1fe977a151346cd2ab29ad33d7d9dbb86413fe6
(cherry picked from commit 85b20b0db469a6a0777192a7f94ea454b9d1cce8)

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I26c3dd5308a47328bc1d9a7a7e989de2b5912c9b

commit_message:
Support spicehtml5proxy on baremetal with haproxy

This patch changes the listener address for spicehtml5proxy from 0.0.0.0
(default) to the nova_management_address to avoid "Address already in use"
errors.

Change-Id: I952998f3c6dd7db218b572c057149352c41c1d65

commit_message:
Switch to osh-deployments deploy-workload script

Since openstack-helm-deployments-test job does not deploy ingress yet,
airshipctl script is currently not compatible with it.

Also this commit mekes openstack-helm-deployments-test voting.

Change-Id: Ic6c15f7ea7d016db1920f2f780921f51fb838b89
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

'}, {'created': '2020-10-07 20:16:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add memcached function and OSH composite

This change adds a memcached function that deploys the OpenStack-Helm
memcached chart [0] and adds the function to a new composite named
OpenStack-Helm. The OpenStack-Helm composite will serve as a releasable collection
of documents that enables operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using
Kustomize [1] and the Helm Operator [2]. Additionally, the
OpenStack-Helm composite can be used as a Kustomize entrypoint for
Airship, enabling operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using airshipctl
[3].

This change adds the OpenStack-Helm composite to the target cluster
workload phase in order to validate the composite using the existing
airshipctl testing infrastructure.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra
[1] https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize
[2] https://github.com/fluxcd/helm-operator
[3] https://opendev.org/airship/airshipctl

Change-Id: I571f8c85028199f4fce3613a03b4812d97906bc9
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-10-07 20:18:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add memcached function and OSH composite

This change adds a memcached function that deploys the OpenStack-Helm
memcached chart [0] and adds the function to a new composite named
OpenStack. The OpenStack composite will serve as a releasable collection
of documents that enables operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using
Kustomize [1] and the Helm Operator [2]. Additionally, the
OpenStack-Helm composite can be used as a Kustomize entrypoint for
Airship, enabling operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using airshipctl
[3].

This change adds the OpenStack composite to the target cluster workload
phase in order to validate the composite using the existing airshipctl
testing infrastructure.

Airship, enabling operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using airshipctl
[3].

This change adds the OpenStack composite to the target cluster workload
phase in order to validate the composite using the existing airshipctl
testing infrastructure.

commit_message:
Add memcached function and OpenStack composite

This change adds a memcached function that deploys the OpenStack-Helm
memcached chart [0] and adds the function to a new composite named
OpenStack. The OpenStack composite will serve as a releasable collection
of documents that enables operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using
Kustomize [1] and the Helm Operator [2]. Additionally, the
OpenStack-Helm composite can be used as a Kustomize entrypoint for
Airship, enabling operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using airshipctl
[3].

This change adds the OpenStack composite to the target cluster workload
phase in order to validate the composite using the existing airshipctl
testing infrastructure.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra
[1] https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize
[2] https://github.com/fluxcd/helm-operator
[3] https://opendev.org/airship/airshipctl

Change-Id: I571f8c85028199f4fce3613a03b4812d97906bc9
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

(6 comments)

Rather than use this as a test commit, we may want to move forward and merge this, as it gets us back to master :)

As a whole, this patch fixes all of our problems, and only fails because it is dependent upon some patches that are not yet complete. The only thing we need to change here is to make openstack-helm-deployments our primary repository, since airshipctl is only used to borrow a few initial phases.

commit_message:
Allow manual setting of Ironic API Version

Typically, the Ironic API client in IPA will autodetect the API version
based on the output of a GET of the root of the API. If for some reason
this API endpoint is restricted, or the operator wishes to limit the
Ironic API version IPA uses, they can now set CONF.ironic_api_version to
avoid autodetection and force a version.

Change-Id: Ib96a1057792f45f2e4554671e32c436140463ee8

commit_message:
Be explicit about the coordination URL

"localhost" can also point to ::1, but the memcached service is only
listening on 127.0.0.1, so be explicit about that in the URL that
we give to tooz.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/759831
Change-Id: I2a2ec20b7645034a23337380005add2e953f9185

commit_message:
add vnic type vdpa

This change extends the portbindings api extention
definition to add a new vnic typew "vdpa" to model
a vhost-vdpa simiar to the exisign vhost-user and
virtio-forwarder vnic types.

Change-Id: I01083fb8192b2ef00934af619576889b881c1249

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Ic0d2dcf20f7929733deb10a275e5d67f9627428f

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8, remove
test B314 since that tests difference between Python 2 and 3,
there's no need to advise using six anymore.
Use oslotest.base directly, this fixes the hacking tests.

Remove ddt usage in testsuite, it does not work with current hacking
version anymore.

Change-Id: Iee4584c6fde08728c017468d9de1db73f2c79d8d

commit_message:
Add Python3 wallaby unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for wallaby.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I8f8fbffec2aeeb649e74b3269da7d7f08f157575

[{'created': '2020-10-28 13:35:49.000000000', 'message': 'cleanup: refactor into galera_mariadb_service_name

We had two variable names which were duplicated for the service
name, this converges them all to "mariadb" which uses the actual
systemd unit instead of the init.d compatiblity layer.

Resolved conflicts in vars/redhat-7.yml and vars/suse.yml during
cherry-pick.

Change-Id: I5805fb11a5118c4011701377cd30b2511edca505
'}]
commit_message:
cleanup: refactor into galera_mariadb_service_name

We had two variable names which were duplicated for the service
name, this converges them all to "mariadb" which uses the actual
systemd unit instead of the init.d compatiblity layer.

Resolved conflicts in vars/redhat-7.yml and vars/suse.yml during
cherry-pick.

Change-Id: I5805fb11a5118c4011701377cd30b2511edca505

[{'created': '2020-10-26 20:20:40.000000000', 'message': 'Make neutron-grenade jobs to be non-voting temporary

Our gate is currently broken due to bug [1] so lets temporary
disable our grenade jobs to unblock the gate.

commit_message:
Make neutron-grenade jobs to be non-voting temporary

Our gate is currently broken due to bug [1] so lets temporary
disable our grenade jobs to unblock the gate.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1901384

Change-Id: Ic0a6d1d8c04be696dc4dc0c0f3c19af0e71b3e16
Related-Bug: #1901384

commit_message:
Move content provider plays to a seperate playbook

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752419 added the content
provider for centos-7 in multinode-standalone-pre.yml and
the playbook become little messy.

In order to keep thing seperate, we are moving the content
provider plays to a seperate playbook and calling the same
in multinode-standalone-pre.yml to avoid distruption in
existing workflow.

Change-Id: I3f8ae8b380b44db49e7a0486efba29d66437bd08
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add capability to delete a backup archive

This patchset adds the capability to delete any archives that are stored
in the local file system or archives that are stored on the remote RGW
data store.

Change-Id: I68cade39e677f895e06ec8f2204f55ff913ce327

commit_message:
[ussuri] Switch tripleo jobs to content provider

Content provider job builds and shares the artifacts among
consumer jobs. This removes dependency on docker.io pulls.

Change-Id: I6bf87c8aa242a30aed30b941d9b34f4877f4452f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendizábal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 17685, 'name': 'Elod Illes', 'email': 'elod.illes@est.tech', 'username': 'elod.illes'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27954, 'name': 'Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros', 'email': 'guimaraes@pm.me', 'username': 'moguimar'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-04-28 19:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-04-29 08:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Please note that the barbican-grenade jobs is not testing barbican at all and it would need some fixes before backporting it (see my comment in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685492/ )'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-06-10 15:08:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Is it possible to create a separate patch that contains only the gate fixing parts, such that:
* 'expired' expiration date updates
* tox-docs job fix

These issues are present in older branches, too, so it would be easier to backport such a patch branch-by-branch."}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2020-07-13 11:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Split patch according to Elod suggestion. We should probably backport the date fixes to all stable branches under maintenance and extended maintenance.'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-10-28 19:41:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Thanks for the feedback, y'all.

I understand the concern about backporting the date fixes to other branches.

Unfortunately, because the stable/ussuri gates are currently broken I actually had to combine this patch with the patch that changes the gerrit configuration to get the gates to patch:

commit_message:
Use Zuulv3 devstack jobs

This patch updates the gate jobs to stop using legacy
jobs and use the new Zuul v3 jobs instead.

The tempest tests will be re-enabled in a future patch.

avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for

Change-Id: I70ca30dd0a5bf0f1aa44f627d92038c826b67174

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I70ca30dd0a5bf0f1aa44f627d92038c826b67174

commit_message:
Skip tripleo_lvmfilter unless enabled or dry_run is set

This is to address the concerns raised in [1]; it skips the role
execution unless the feature is either explicitly enabled or the
caller has set dry_run variable which will make it run up to the
creation of the new lvm.conf file but not actually copy it into
place.

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697990/49/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_lvmfilter/tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I1c914feda3c4b1bfb6dcfd981244477f82915b75
(cherry picked from commit d1a5769313d4bee52abff6efda64bc9182b42664)

commit_message:
Add [Link] configuration to network file to support live MTU changes

This patch adds the MTUBytes interface configuration option to the
systemd .network file to support live MTU changes upon restart
of systemd-networkd. Without it, MTU changes will only be effective
upon boot.

Change-Id: I0e1c6cbe3351dd3f8acfa911dedc6e0e29413c80

commit_message:
Remove references to setuptools

Newer versions of cliff and stevedore use importlib rather than
setuptools to work with entry points. Replace any references to
"setuptools' entry points mechanism" with "Python's entry points
mechanism".

Change-Id: Iae36155685ee37ab5e38a0c173110a5ece33d05d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-12 16:16:53.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: 'video.vram' property must be an integer

The 'vram' property of the 'video' device must be an integer else
libvirt will spit the dummy out, e.g.

  libvirt.libvirtError: XML error: cannot parse video vram '8192.0'

The division operator in Python 3 results in a float, not an integer
like in Python 2. Use the truncation division operator instead.

Change-Id: Iebf678c229da4f455459d068cafeee5f241aea1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1896496
(cherry picked from commit f2ca089bce842127e7d0644b38a11da9278db8ea)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: 'video.vram' property must be an integer

The 'vram' property of the 'video' device must be an integer else
libvirt will spit the dummy out, e.g.

  libvirt.libvirtError: XML error: cannot parse video vram '8192.0'

The division operator in Python 3 results in a float, not an integer
like in Python 2. Use the truncation division operator instead.

Change-Id: Iebf678c229da4f455459d068cafeee5f241aea1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1896496
(cherry picked from commit f2ca089bce842127e7d0644b38a11da9278db8ea)

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix get/update/delete of non-OVN agents

At some point, KeyError stopped being raised by get_agent and
instead the AgentNotFound exception. This meant that the patched
plugin methods would not be called for {get,update,delete}_agent
calls for non-OVN agents.

Change-Id: Id755a9eec08414d7a77e67a426d7796fae693ac7
Closes-Bug: #1895033
(cherry picked from commit 0a785e90c32a8e96e61ad6353fdc75b04e97e357)

Fix frozen graph errors for zuul templates


Exclude for now all zuul.d/* layouts from "irrelevant files" so that
all jobs should have run.

commit_message:
Bump magnum tempest plugin

In 1.0.0 release magnum tempest plugin has dropped py2.7 support
So we bump the supported version since centos 7 fails otherwise

commit_message:
Skip tripleo_lvmfilter unless enabled or dry_run is set

This is to address the concerns raised in [1]; it skips the role
execution unless the feature is either explicitly enabled or the
caller has set dry_run variable which will make it run up to the
creation of the new lvm.conf file but not actually copy it into
place.

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697990/49/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_lvmfilter/tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I1c914feda3c4b1bfb6dcfd981244477f82915b75
(cherry picked from commit d1a5769313d4bee52abff6efda64bc9182b42664)

users: Correct lock_password status visibility (Yes/No) in user details

Before this change, it would always say No, regardless of actual
setting.

commit_message:
Retries and timeout for IPA command

Adds retries and timeout configuration parameters for IPA
commands that can fail in case of network glitches.

Change-Id: I817a07bf38c0ee1dd7e8599cf4d646a22ab7027f
Story: #2004420
Task: #28071
(cherry picked from commit a2cffd8c4a12c2967c8424ccc2cca0189a70be75)
(cherry picked from commit 5673679f69e2c0fe35150ffed127c96d282f3655)

(1 comment)

I agree that this needs probably reworking to fit expectations with actual actions, but this patch at the moment doesn't fix behaviour..."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-05-27 13:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 819, 'date': '2020-05-27 20:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-15 07:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 819, 'date': '2020-10-15 13:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Here is the problem I see with the current code...

If you just only force_containers_destroy to True, then the container will NOT be destroyed (task "Destroy a container") but /var/lib/lxc/{{ container_name }} (which includes the rootfs) will be deleted (task "Destroy container service directories"). That makes no sense, does it?'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-15 15:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Dmitriy Rabotyagov (noonedeadpunk) <noonedeadpunk@ya.ru>
'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-15 15:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-15 15:39:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

we probably should just drop force_containers_data_destroy at all as it's pretty confusing overall"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-26 16:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-10-26 18:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-27 07:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-27 07:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-10-28 07:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Actually destroy container even if keeping data

The destroy container task should be run even if the data is not going
to be destroyed.

Change-Id: If8d9b7ed1d146e97c4f3fa4ad430d6ab72f857e3

commit_message:
[goal] Migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for required deps which added python3.8
support in their later version.

- noqa for pep8 C901 check.

Closes-Bug: #1886298

Story: #2007865
Task: #40186

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal

Change-Id: I67b4957cea1ccbd5cdc0314d2eaddef0c24f7dfc

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-24 15:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-29 10:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-08-19 15:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-10-28 14:36:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:33:38.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I19e5c51f5ffa30a1257a9cc2d0b43dd35de79d5a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I19e5c51f5ffa30a1257a9cc2d0b43dd35de79d5a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

work with changes in ops_openstack.core.

commit_message:
Make docs build parallel

This updates our thread extension and tox command for docs builds to use
the available number of cores to multithread the docs build. This can
speed things up significantly.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/741026

Change-Id: I1ba656390094b4e1c6d3fb7bb3028eadb11c4d08
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: No longer display location
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-10-28 14:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-10-28 14:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-28 14:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'No longer display location

The location code was created to allow for emergency relocation of
meetings, however in a virtual setting that is tracked using the "url"
feature. When location and urls differ it can create a lot of confusion.

It's better to stop displaying location for virtual PTGs. As an
emergency fix, let's stop displaying the location.

Change-Id: Ibb9d96e1fa7f686e31cc8d9b51e3826af8c4b015
'}]
commit_message:
No longer display location

The location code was created to allow for emergency relocation of
meetings, however in a virtual setting that is tracked using the "url"
feature. When location and urls differ it can create a lot of confusion.

It's better to stop displaying location for virtual PTGs. As an
emergency fix, let's stop displaying the location.

Change-Id: Ibb9d96e1fa7f686e31cc8d9b51e3826af8c4b015

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-10-28 14:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-06 15:40:42.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I01042f7ca33588a25b2d735f27a47695ec6cd7d2
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I01042f7ca33588a25b2d735f27a47695ec6cd7d2

[{'created': '2020-10-27 17:09:04.000000000', 'message': 'The standalone job at present has a high chance of failure
due to two separate things occuring:

1) The deployed nodes from raid tests can be left in a dirty state
   as the raid configuration remains and is chosen as the root
   device for the next deployment. IF this is chosen by any job,
   such as rescue or a deployment test that attempts to login,
   then the job fails with unable to ssh. The fix for this is
   in the ironic-tempest-plugin but we need to get other fixes
   into stablilize the gate first.
   https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757141/
2) Long running scenarios run in cleaning such as deployment with
   RAID in the standalone suite can encounter conditions where
   the conductor tries to send the next command along before the
   present configuration command has completed. An example is
   downloading the image is still running, while a heartbeat
   has occured in the background and the conductor then seeks
   to perform a second action. This then causes the entire
   deployment to fail, even though it was transitory.
   This should be a relatively easy fix.
   https://review.opendev.org/759906

Change-Id: I6b02be0fa353daac90abf2b1576800c0710f651e

commit_message:
Mark standalone job non-voting/remove from gate

The standalone job at present has a high chance of failure
due to two separate things occuring:

1) The deployed nodes from raid tests can be left in a dirty state
   as the raid configuration remains and is chosen as the root
   device for the next deployment. IF this is chosen by any job,
   such as rescue or a deployment test that attempts to login,
   then the job fails with unable to ssh. The fix for this is
   in the ironic-tempest-plugin but we need to get other fixes
   into stablilize the gate first.
   https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757141/
2) Long running scenarios run in cleaning such as deployment with
   RAID in the standalone suite can encounter conditions where
   the conductor tries to send the next command along before the
   present configuration command has completed. An example is
   downloading the image is still running, while a heartbeat
   has occured in the background and the conductor then seeks
   to perform a second action. This then causes the entire
   deployment to fail, even though it was transitory.
   This should be a relatively easy fix.
   https://review.opendev.org/759906

Change-Id: I6b02be0fa353daac90abf2b1576800c0710f651e

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active in processutils

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I0a2c1e0d8a8cad99d68100d25e88e0d3a2eb8f5c
Related-Bug: #1863021
(cherry picked from commit 6533958f5fcec8b1577f56834ea2dc75a4f211e3)

commit_message:
RBD: Run flatten in a different thread when cloning a volume

The current implementation of create_cloned_volume calls flatten
directly, and this makes whole thread of cinder-volume blocked by that
flatten call. This causes heartbeat timeout in RabbitMQ when cloning
a volume with rbd backend.

This patch makes sure that flatten is executed in a different thread,
to allow heatbeat thread to run while flattening a rbd image.

Closes-Bug: #1898918
Change-Id: I9f28260008117abcebfc96dbe69bf892f5cd14fe
(cherry picked from commit bafe440b9418a1e3acd00456872d4d97a9c64c61)
(cherry picked from commit f1521d82d941e711f6ef248a7eb81f096de8135f)

commit_message:
Config options for AMQP1 transport in collectd sensubility

This patch exposes configuration options for setting up collectd
sensubility to use AMQP1 transport. This is primarily for
compatability with the Service Telemetry Framework.

Change-Id: Id74eb494e022e88f0a1d5c1044d3a7a283b5178f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758482/

commit_message:
Puppet config options for AMQP1 sensubility transport

This patch introduces configuration options to setup collectd
sensubility to use the AMQP1 transport. This is primarily for
STF compatability.

Change-Id: I5a153004e0175f6826bfd10ac25b7e6f9ce09b96

commit_message:
Move image_field_data method in-tree

this was removed in Horizon as 'not needed' in
26eebd4abbbabc1475bae61c51d1cfcf14dba770
however it is used to form a hint for glance.image constraint
in heat-dashboard.

Just copy-paste the method as it existed in horizon with minimal
adaptations.

Change-Id: I23fd3f45f0ce5b67691991336e727c377ca36281

After changing the boot device via Redfish, check that the boot mode being
reported matches what is configured and, if not, set it to the configured
value.  Some BMCs change the boot mode when the device is set via Redfish,
this will ensure the mode is set properly.

Change-Id: Ib077f7f32de029833e6bd936853c382305bce36e
Story: 2008252
Task: 41103
'}]
commit_message:
Sync boot mode when changing the boot device via Redfish

After changing the boot device via Redfish, check that the boot mode being
reported matches what is configured and, if not, set it to the configured
value.  Some BMCs change the boot mode when the device is set via Redfish,
this will ensure the mode is set properly.

Change-Id: Ib077f7f32de029833e6bd936853c382305bce36e
Story: 2008252
Task: 41103

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3049823b6a5e23f0e8bae3be4f546dc6b9fa2348

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints and pep8 for Focal

Bump lower-constraints to versions supporting python 3.8 and with wheels
available and sync requirements

Bump hacking to 3.2.0 in order to work with Focal, disabling W504
to align with neutron

Clean pep8 requirements from lower-constraints

Change-Id: I743acf9f2b7d7000e3340fee4887c8a1f3647133
(cherry picked from commit 5ea0ed67c45e6f76cae40c28cbe361a62b66142c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-28 12:02:12.000000000', 'message': 'Wrap buildah push with a timeout

Sometimes buildah push just hangs and CI job times out after all the
allowed time expires. That consumes the pipeline slots and nodepool
resourses in very suboptimal way. Add a timeout that defaults to a
600s.

Change-Id: Ief0478848ef90cad949c12ddab3ad5c6a83b70eb
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-10-28 12:21:14.000000000', 'message': 'Wrap buildah push with a timeout

Sometimes buildah push just hangs and CI job times out after all the
allowed time expires. That consumes the pipeline slots and nodepool
resourses in very suboptimal way. Add a timeout that defaults to a

Change-Id: Ief0478848ef90cad949c12ddab3ad5c6a83b70eb

commit_message:
Wrap buildah push with a timeout

Sometimes buildah push just hangs and CI job times out after all the
allowed time expires. That consumes the pipeline slots and nodepool
resourses in very suboptimal way. Add a timeout that defaults to a
600s.

Change-Id: Ief0478848ef90cad949c12ddab3ad5c6a83b70eb
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Run dib ipa src jobs on ubuntu focal

Also disabling dstat in all focal based jobs because of
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/dstat/+bug/1866619
Plus including increase of alloc memory to increase job
success rate, original change from [1]
And re-enabling ipa-tempest-bios-ipmi-direct-src and
ipa-tempest-bios-ipmi-iscsi-src

[1] https://review.opendev.org/759765

Co-authored-by: Julia Kreger <juliaashleykreger@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia154745b71c17063eeaaabeb56950ab1cc9ce927

commit_message:
Move the multinode grenade job to the experimental pipeline

It's hopelessly broken, let's not waste resources on it until we
get back to making it work.

Change-Id: I171fa566e36ad5ac8659ecb0578029df270497d6

There are certain HA clustered services (e.g. galera) that don't
have the ability natively to reload their TLS certificate without
being restarted. If too many replicas are restarted concurrently
this might result in full service disruption.

To ensure service availability, provide a means to ensure that
only one service replica is restarted at a time in the cluster.
This works by using pacemaker's CIB to implement a cluster-wide
restart lock for a service. The lock has a TTL so it's guaranteed
to be eventually released without requiring complex contingency
cleanup in case of failures.

Tested locally by running the following:
1. force recreate certificate on all nodes at once for galera
   (ipa-cert resubmit -i mysql), and verify that the resources
   restart one after the other

2. create a lock manually in pacemaker, recreate certificate for
   galera on all nodes, and verify that no resource is restarted
   before the manually created lock expires.

3. create a lock manually, let it expires, recreate a certificate,
   and verify that the resource is restarted appropriately and the
   lock gets cleaned up from pacemaker once the restart finished.

Closes-Bug: #1885113
Change-Id: Ib2b62e33b34cf72edfdae6299cf432259bf960a2

restart lock for a service. The lock has a TTL so it's guaranteed
to be eventually released without requiring complex contingency
cleanup in case of failures.

Tested locally by running the following:
1. force recreate certificate on all nodes at once for galera
   (ipa-cert resubmit -i mysql), and verify that the resources
   restart one after the other

2. create a lock manually in pacemaker, recreate certificate for
   galera on all nodes, and verify that no resource is restarted
   before the manually created lock expires.

3. create a lock manually, let it expires, recreate a certificate,
   and verify that the resource is restarted appropriately and the
   lock gets cleaned up from pacemaker once the restart finished.

Closes-Bug: #1885113
Change-Id: Ib2b62e33b34cf72edfdae6299cf432259bf960a2
"}]
commit_message:
Rolling certificate update for HA services

There are certain HA clustered services (e.g. galera) that don't
have the ability natively to reload their TLS certificate without
being restarted. If too many replicas are restarted concurrently
this might result in full service disruption.

To ensure service availability, provide a means to ensure that
only one service replica is restarted at a time in the cluster.
This works by using pacemaker's CIB to implement a cluster-wide
restart lock for a service. The lock has a TTL so it's guaranteed
to be eventually released without requiring complex contingency
cleanup in case of failures.

Tested locally by running the following:
1. force recreate certificate on all nodes at once for galera
   (ipa-cert resubmit -i mysql), and verify that the resources
   restart one after the other

2. create a lock manually in pacemaker, recreate certificate for
   galera on all nodes, and verify that no resource is restarted
   before the manually created lock expires.

3. create a lock manually, let it expires, recreate a certificate,
   and verify that the resource is restarted appropriately and the
   lock gets cleaned up from pacemaker once the restart finished.

Closes-Bug: #1885113
Change-Id: Ib2b62e33b34cf72edfdae6299cf432259bf960a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-27 09:01:30.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Only ask tpool.Proxy to autowrap vir* classes

I668643c836d46a25df46d4c99a973af5e50a39db attempted to fix service wide
pauses by providing a more complete list of classes to tpool.Proxy.

While this excluded libvirtError it can include internal libvirt-python
classes pointed to by private globals that have been introduced with the
use of type checking within the module.

Any attempt to wrap these internal classes will result in the failure
seen in bug #1901383. As a result this change simply ignores any class
found during inspection that doesn't start with the `vir` string, used
by libvirt to denote public methods and classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901383
Change-Id: I568b0c4fd6069b9118ff116532f14abb46cc42ab

commit_message:
libvirt: Only ask tpool.Proxy to autowrap vir* classes

I668643c836d46a25df46d4c99a973af5e50a39db attempted to fix service wide
pauses by providing a more complete list of classes to tpool.Proxy.

While this excluded libvirtError it can include internal libvirt-python
classes pointed to by private globals that have been introduced with the
use of type checking within the module.

Any attempt to wrap these internal classes will result in the failure
seen in bug #1901383. As a result this change simply ignores any class
found during inspection that doesn't start with the `vir` string, used
by libvirt to denote public methods and classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901383
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I568b0c4fd6069b9118ff116532f14abb46cc42ab

commit_message:
Updated the weights section of Compute schedulers in nova

Description: Mentioning cells in here is not qualified as only
for cells v1, which is deprecated. So, removed them to avoid
confusion. The "Host weighting options" section lists several
options with their now deprecated config option group: replaced
the table with descriptions to a list of related options, so
there is context. Linked the url
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/user/filter-scheduler.html#weights
which actually explains the various in-tree weighers.

Change-Id: Ie81e9dc72dd254127f7ed9d974fab886dc2ee8a2
Closes-Bug: #1805233

commit_message:
Raising a deprecated warning in case of 403

Description: Running openstack flavor set from a project in which a user
has an admin role allows the provided project to be mapped to the flavor
even if the permissions are insufficient for the user to verify the
project provided. Raising a Deprecated warning for this release and
Returning failure in future relases.

Change-Id: I944052c6483b815099e18d6f9176ce136f00bbbc
Closes-Bug: #1854053

@Gael We can discuss offline, but since the whole point of these Vagrants are to make repeatable disposable dev environments, virtualenv seems a little excessive, and perhaps needlessly complicated here.

I've implemented all other suggests by you and Cedric, though; please take another look. :-)"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-10-09 05:32:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)

Not really sure about the paths (see comments inline).

But I mostly tend to agree with David - virtualenv is probably overkill for a vagrant env, since it's supposed to be droppable and rebuildable on demand."}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2020-10-21 17:34:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > Not really sure about the paths (see comments inline).
 > 
 > But I mostly tend to agree with David - virtualenv is probably
 > overkill for a vagrant env, since it's supposed to be droppable and
 > rebuildable on demand.

We might have to take this to IRC about the pathing because it works well in my test environment; the moment I start messing with the vagrant user with sudo it introduces complications.

```
    default: Copying validations_common.egg-info to /usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/validations_common-1.1.2.dev11-py3.6.egg-info
    default: running install_scripts
    default: copying build/scripts-3.6/validation.py -> /usr/local/bin
    default: changing mode of /usr/local/bin/validation.py to 755
    default: /home/vagrant
zelda ➜  vfcentosdev git:(master) vagrant ssh    
[vagrant@ibm-p8-kvm-03-guest-02 ~]$ validation.py 
usage: validation.py [-h] [--inventory INVENTORY]
                     [--validation <validation_id>[,<validation_id>,...]]
                     [--group <group>[,<group>,...]] [--quiet QUIET]
                     [--validation-dir VALIDATION_DIR]
                     [--ansible-base-dir ANSIBLE_BASE_DIR]
                     [--output-log OUTPUT_LOG]
                     {run,list,show}
validation.py: error: the following arguments are required: action
[vagrant@ibm-p8-kvm-03-guest-02 ~]$ validation.py list
+----+------+--------+
| ID | Name | Groups |
+----+------+--------+
+----+------+--------+
```

I'm pretty sure this is perfectly usable as is, but of course happy to discuss options.

Thanks for the feedback so far folks. :-)"}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2020-10-21 17:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-10-27 15:46:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Add NovaDisableImageDownloadToRbd parameter

This exposes the nova workaround to disable downloading images from glance to
rbd (vs a cheap COW clone) when nova-compute and glance are not backed by the
same ceph cluster.

Related nova change: I069b6b1d28eaf1eee5c7fb8d0fdef9c0c229a1bf
Depends-On: I8329810d6c047c0d94e7b123e7cdc1263a7856cd

Change-Id: Ib5478e53eb1f216bf6924ff30ea8502cb8529d00

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-27 17:07:51.000000000', 'message': 'Mark standalone job non-voting/remove from gate

The standalone job at present has a high chance of failure
due to two separate things occuring:

1) The deployed nodes from raid tests can be left in a dirty state
   as the raid configuration remains and is chosen as the root
   device for the next deployment. IF this is chosen by any job,
   such as rescue or a deployment test that attempts to login,
   then the job fails with unable to ssh. The fix for this is
   in the ironic-tempest-plugin but we need to get other fixes
   into stablilize the gate first.
   https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757141/
2) Long running scenarios run in cleaning such as deployment with
   RAID in the standalone suite can encounter conditions where
   the conductor tries to send the next command along before the
   present configuration command has completed. An example is
   downloading the image is still running, while a heartbeat
   has occured in the background and the conductor then seeks
   to perform a second action. This then causes the entire
   deployment to fail, even though it was transitory.
   This should be a relatively easy fix.
   https://review.opendev.org/759906

Change-Id: I08c8c258587dd3786dfa92e7879a80c80971d7df
'}, {'created': '2020-10-27 20:29:34.000000000', 'message': 'Mark standalone job non-voting/remove from gate

The standalone job at present has a high chance of failure
due to two separate things occuring:

1) The deployed nodes from raid tests can be left in a dirty state
   as the raid configuration remains and is chosen as the root
   device for the next deployment. IF this is chosen by any job,
   such as rescue or a deployment test that attempts to login,
   then the job fails with unable to ssh. The fix for this is
   in the ironic-tempest-plugin but we need to get other fixes
   into stablilize the gate first.
   https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757141/
2) Long running scenarios run in cleaning such as deployment with
   RAID in the standalone suite can encounter conditions where
   the conductor tries to send the next command along before the
   present configuration command has completed. An example is
   downloading the image is still running, while a heartbeat
   has occured in the background and the conductor then seeks
   to perform a second action. This then causes the entire
   deployment to fail, even though it was transitory.
   This should be a relatively easy fix.
   https://review.opendev.org/759906

Also disabling ipa-tempest-bios-ipmi-direct-src and
ipa-tempest-bios-ipmi-iscsi-src for the time being, will revert
in https://review.opendev.org/757812

Change-Id: I08c8c258587dd3786dfa92e7879a80c80971d7df
'}]
commit_message:
Mark standalone job non-voting/remove from gate

The standalone job at present has a high chance of failure
due to two separate things occuring:

1) The deployed nodes from raid tests can be left in a dirty state
   as the raid configuration remains and is chosen as the root
   device for the next deployment. IF this is chosen by any job,
   such as rescue or a deployment test that attempts to login,
   then the job fails with unable to ssh. The fix for this is
   in the ironic-tempest-plugin but we need to get other fixes
   into stablilize the gate first.
   https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757141/
2) Long running scenarios run in cleaning such as deployment with
   RAID in the standalone suite can encounter conditions where
   the conductor tries to send the next command along before the
   present configuration command has completed. An example is
   downloading the image is still running, while a heartbeat
   has occured in the background and the conductor then seeks
   to perform a second action. This then causes the entire
   deployment to fail, even though it was transitory.
   This should be a relatively easy fix.
   https://review.opendev.org/759906

Also disabling ipa-tempest-bios-ipmi-direct-src and
ipa-tempest-bios-ipmi-iscsi-src for the time being, will revert
in https://review.opendev.org/757812

Change-Id: I08c8c258587dd3786dfa92e7879a80c80971d7df

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 08:44:23.000000000', 'message': '[fix] Sync nodegroup status before delete_complete

Magnum cluster deletion is not behaving as expected. While it appears to
delete successfully, _delete_complete routine in
magnum/drivers/heat/driver.py is never called because the status of
nodegroups have not had the chance to sync with Heat before
_check_delete_complete is called. As a result, for example, trustee user
accounts are left orphaned. This PS changes or order of activities so
that _delete_complete is invoked successfully.

Story: 2007965
Task: 40459

Change-Id: Ibadd5b57fe175bb0b100266e2dbcc2e1ea4efcf9
(cherry picked from commit 1cdc0628a28da32ef52324244a4c97b0794c2542)
'}]
commit_message:
[fix] Sync nodegroup status before delete_complete

Magnum cluster deletion is not behaving as expected. While it appears to
delete successfully, _delete_complete routine in
magnum/drivers/heat/driver.py is never called because the status of
nodegroups have not had the chance to sync with Heat before
_check_delete_complete is called. As a result, for example, trustee user
accounts are left orphaned. This PS changes or order of activities so
that _delete_complete is invoked successfully.

Story: 2007965
Task: 40459

Change-Id: Ibadd5b57fe175bb0b100266e2dbcc2e1ea4efcf9
(cherry picked from commit 1cdc0628a28da32ef52324244a4c97b0794c2542)

[{'created': '2020-10-27 14:25:44.000000000', 'message': "Allow to setup docker registry in CentOS7

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752421/ made the
registry setup conditional based on buildcontainers_venv which
is true by default.

In RDO CloudSIG jobs we don't use venv by setting
buildcontainers_venv to false and thus now registry
is not being setup. Add an optional var which will
provide interface to setup registry when required for
ex in CloudSIG RDO jobs.

Change-Id: Ic270a03354c426e53b9293743f2da2a15e9e8fe6
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to setup docker registry in CentOS7

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752421/ made the
registry setup conditional based on buildcontainers_venv which
is true by default.

In RDO CloudSIG jobs we don't use venv by setting
buildcontainers_venv to false and thus now registry
is not being setup. Add an optional var which will
provide interface to setup registry when required for
ex in CloudSIG RDO jobs.

Change-Id: Ic270a03354c426e53b9293743f2da2a15e9e8fe6

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If9a2a11373d14d87385d60f3b1ec1514ec94f20b

commit_message:
Remove cloud-config from k8s worker node

Now Magnum is not deploying any service or workload on k8s
worker nodes which need to get credentials from local to talk
to Magnum control plane. So the cloud-config file should be
removed from worker nodes to reduce the attach surface from
a security point of view.

Task: 40791
Story: 2008090

Change-Id: I72e418491cbd19291527bbe4b504d599c740fea9
(cherry picked from commit c84653cd74d4981430096d4a9494ba8827a34caa)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-02 16:50:13.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that openstack client can connect with auth_ed25519

Openstack clients connect to the mysql database with pymysql.
When a stack is configured to use auth_ed25519 for client
authentication, pymysql requires package python3-pynacl for
the crypto bits needed to implement the authentication.

Make sure to install python3-pynacl on the base openstack
image so that all clients can use auth_ed25519.

Change-Id: I37b0fe7b8399b7eb2a615a331b3e8c5cf1be5d4c
Closes-Bug: #1898263
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that openstack client can connect with auth_ed25519

Openstack clients connect to the mysql database with pymysql.
When a stack is configured to use auth_ed25519 for client
authentication, pymysql requires package python3-pynacl for
the crypto bits needed to implement the authentication.

Make sure to install python3-pynacl on the base openstack
image so that all clients can use auth_ed25519.

Change-Id: I37b0fe7b8399b7eb2a615a331b3e8c5cf1be5d4c
Closes-Bug: #1898263

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-28 08:15:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

Change-Id: I6ca48027c1dd2f58f82a64fab31bc8269cd2a9aa
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

Change-Id: I6ca48027c1dd2f58f82a64fab31bc8269cd2a9aa

commit_message:
RBD: Run flatten in a different thread when cloning a volume

The current implementation of create_cloned_volume calls flatten
directly, and this makes whole thread of cinder-volume blocked by that
flatten call. This causes heartbeat timeout in RabbitMQ when cloning
a volume with rbd backend.

This patch makes sure that flatten is executed in a different thread,
to allow heatbeat thread to run while flattening a rbd image.

Closes-Bug: #1898918
Change-Id: I9f28260008117abcebfc96dbe69bf892f5cd14fe
(cherry picked from commit bafe440b9418a1e3acd00456872d4d97a9c64c61)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-18 06:53:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix revert to snapshot for non admins

When a non user calls revert to snapshot using the snapshot name the
client returns a failure status:

  $ cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.59 revert-to-snapshot snap1
    ERROR: No snapshot with a name or ID of 'snap1' exists.

The revert to snapshot API requires an UUID, so the cinderclient lists
the snapshots passing "all_tenants=1" and the name of the snapshot to
find its first when it's not a UUID.

The problem that we were only removing the "all_tenants" filter for
admins, leaving it for normal users and passing it to the DB which
wouldn't understand that filter and return None.

This patch ensure we always remove the "all_tenants" filter (as we do in
other places) before calling the OVO method to list snapshots.

Change-Id: I5fd3d7840b36f6805143cd1b837258232e7bc58a
Fixes-Bug: #1889758
(cherry picked from commit 71a080b22688c2fb15545736e807d233932e22e8)
(cherry picked from commit d51dc099a3c7bc1008dd3e158664a81de54b2cdd)
'}, {'created': '2020-10-15 14:11:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix revert to snapshot for non admins

When a non user calls revert to snapshot using the snapshot name the
client returns a failure status:

  $ cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.59 revert-to-snapshot snap1
    ERROR: No snapshot with a name or ID of 'snap1' exists.

The revert to snapshot API requires an UUID, so the cinderclient lists
the snapshots passing "all_tenants=1" and the name of the snapshot to
find its first when it's not a UUID.

The problem that we were only removing the "all_tenants" filter for
admins, leaving it for normal users and passing it to the DB which
wouldn't understand that filter and return None.

This patch ensure we always remove the "all_tenants" filter (as we do in
other places) before calling the OVO method to list snapshots.

Change-Id: I5fd3d7840b36f6805143cd1b837258232e7bc58a
Fixes-Bug: #1889758
(cherry picked from commit 71a080b22688c2fb15545736e807d233932e22e8)
(cherry picked from commit d51dc099a3c7bc1008dd3e158664a81de54b2cdd)
(cherry picked from commit 54433cb8c096298972f661b029091f611d73870e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix revert to snapshot for non admins

When a non user calls revert to snapshot using the snapshot name the
client returns a failure status:

  $ cinder --os-volume-api-version 3.59 revert-to-snapshot snap1
    ERROR: No snapshot with a name or ID of 'snap1' exists.

The revert to snapshot API requires an UUID, so the cinderclient lists
the snapshots passing "all_tenants=1" and the name of the snapshot to
find its first when it's not a UUID.

The problem that we were only removing the "all_tenants" filter for
admins, leaving it for normal users and passing it to the DB which
wouldn't understand that filter and return None.

This patch ensure we always remove the "all_tenants" filter (as we do in
other places) before calling the OVO method to list snapshots.

Change-Id: I5fd3d7840b36f6805143cd1b837258232e7bc58a
Fixes-Bug: #1889758
(cherry picked from commit 71a080b22688c2fb15545736e807d233932e22e8)
(cherry picked from commit d51dc099a3c7bc1008dd3e158664a81de54b2cdd)
(cherry picked from commit 54433cb8c096298972f661b029091f611d73870e)

Update ingress tpl in helmtoolkit

- Check issuer type to distinguish the annotation between
clusterissuer and issuer
- Add one more annotation "certmanager.k8s.io/xx" for old version

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-30 07:05:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix revert snapshot issue

While there is a related fcmap stays in 100% copying clone state,
and this volume act as target volume in fcmap relationship,
revert snapshot will fail. This fix will stop 100% copying clone
fcmap, then let revert snapshot go.

Closes-bug: #1863070

commit_message:
Fix revert snapshot issue

While there is a related fcmap stays in 100% copying clone state,
and this volume act as target volume in fcmap relationship,
revert snapshot will fail. This fix will stop 100% copying clone
fcmap, then let revert snapshot go.

Closes-bug: #1863070

Change-Id: I6b5f6396ad5524f4086ce5192e32fd5e7fee58a2
(cherry picked from commit 9b4321f8462b32206c8d684442606b57a6af20da)
(cherry picked from commit 257c1c16fa0711130772bb36a5d04e9563c583b1)

commit_message:
Ensure we're using proper types for validation_name and _id

In some case we might get string instead of list - instead of failing,
just do a simple convertion and go on.

We also support both notation, either playbook name (foo.yaml) and
validation name (foo) in the search of valid content.

Co-Authored-By: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I8d0288dae3cab131a8bc65e3d0b986dc6b9aec67
Closes-Bug: #1901676
