messages: [{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-10-13 08:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23084, 'date': '2020-10-21 12:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-10-22 09:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-10-28 07:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-13 08:44:00.000000000', 'message': '[fix] Sync nodegroup status before delete_complete

Magnum cluster deletion is not behaving as expected. While it appears to
delete successfully, _delete_complete routine in
magnum/drivers/heat/driver.py is never called because the status of
nodegroups have not had the chance to sync with Heat before
_check_delete_complete is called. As a result, for example, trustee user
accounts are left orphaned. This PS changes or order of activities so
that _delete_complete is invoked successfully.

Story: 2007965
Task: 40459

Change-Id: Ibadd5b57fe175bb0b100266e2dbcc2e1ea4efcf9
(cherry picked from commit 1cdc0628a28da32ef52324244a4c97b0794c2542)
'}]
commit_message:
[fix] Sync nodegroup status before delete_complete

Magnum cluster deletion is not behaving as expected. While it appears to
delete successfully, _delete_complete routine in
magnum/drivers/heat/driver.py is never called because the status of
nodegroups have not had the chance to sync with Heat before
_check_delete_complete is called. As a result, for example, trustee user
accounts are left orphaned. This PS changes or order of activities so
that _delete_complete is invoked successfully.

Story: 2007965
Task: 40459

Change-Id: Ibadd5b57fe175bb0b100266e2dbcc2e1ea4efcf9
(cherry picked from commit 1cdc0628a28da32ef52324244a4c97b0794c2542)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-28 07:47:44.000000000', 'message': 'Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: Ia53f74eb45b4782689d7bd3f3cab044f58997c5e
'}]
commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: Ia53f74eb45b4782689d7bd3f3cab044f58997c5e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-31 19:36:09.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Deploy multipathd using tripleo_multipathd ansible role

The puppet and ansible tasks for deploying the Multipathd service have
been moved to a new tripleo_multipathd ansible role. THT uses that role
passing in parameter values via ansible variables.

Two new THT parameters are supported:
- MultipathdCustomConfigFile provides a way for the user to specify a
  custom multipath.conf file. This makes it easier for the user to
  manage custom settings that are unique to their deployment, such as
  vendor specific hardware tuning.
- MultipathdSkipKpartx provides a means for overriding multipathd's
  default behavior whereby it automatically creates disk partitions on
  multipath devices. Partitions should be managed by VM servers accessing
  the device, not by the overcloud host itself.

Depends-On: Icf9faff31d83f0ea77d00a59a53d6ad36b06da4f
Change-Id: I934a1ae5bc0d77fd39b25f5039635e5df6e9004f

Depends-On: I3478312b5117da5c2e819e47c99f574246e84838
Change-Id: I934a1ae5bc0d77fd39b25f5039635e5df6e9004f
"}]
commit_message:
Deploy multipathd using tripleo_multipathd ansible role

The puppet and ansible tasks for deploying the Multipathd service have
been moved to a new tripleo_multipathd ansible role. THT uses that role
passing in parameter values via ansible variables.

Two new THT parameters are supported:
- MultipathdCustomConfigFile provides a way for the user to specify a
  custom multipath.conf file. This makes it easier for the user to
  manage custom settings that are unique to their deployment, such as
  vendor specific hardware tuning.
- MultipathdSkipKpartx provides a means for overriding multipathd's
  default behavior whereby it automatically creates disk partitions on
  multipath devices. Partitions should be managed by VM servers accessing
  the device, not by the overcloud host itself.

Depends-On: Icf9faff31d83f0ea77d00a59a53d6ad36b06da4f
Depends-On: I3478312b5117da5c2e819e47c99f574246e84838
Change-Id: I934a1ae5bc0d77fd39b25f5039635e5df6e9004f

commit_message:
Remove ceph-pg from openstack tripleo validator run groups

By design this validation will never suceed when run by openstack
tripleo validator run and thus it should be removed from the groups
that would cause it to be run this way.

Change-Id: I4ad2c6efe18a2cc63c6fa5189d420d7a2be1f753
Closes-Bug: #1900713
(cherry picked from commit 94b0d3c4a36eada16be4f0c2b079c7968cd9cc9c)

commit_message:
Refactor some unit tests

Remove mocking of six.move.builtins.open, remove mocked open() from
unit tests that didn't need it, and refactor tests to use mock_open()
instead of a "regular" mock, and to keep the namespace where open()
is defined as local as possible.

Change-Id: I7f13fd8fb56e4ff37f2517e324862f9f9a504152
Implements: blueprint six-removal

commit_message:
Add mypy tox env

Add a "mypy" tox environment which runs mypy
type checking against Cinder code.

Taken from Stephen Finucane's Nova work at
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676208/

Added "show_error_codes" and "pretty" options.

Generates an html report in ./mypy-report/

This adds stubs for oslo.i18n, so that _() calls
are annotated as intended.  It may be possible to
do this with less .pyi files carried along here.

Change-Id: I2589d22c1f16f2e177d34730a520591743c0c1e3

commit_message:
Remove six of dir cinder/volume/*

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.add_metaclass
- six.PY3
- six.text_type
- six.string_types
- six.integer_types

Change-Id: Ifc3484ef0897d25c3a5ed3c10efe4312dbbbd384
Implements: blueprint six-removal

commit_message:
Remove six of files under cinder/test/unit

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.PY3
- six.add_metaclass
- six.string_types
- six.text_type
- six.moves
- six.StringIO
- six.reraise
- six.wraps

Change-Id: Id27e6823244bc6a81ce1301b32cee79dd99e771a
Implements: blueprint six-removal

commit_message:
RBD: Run flatten in a different thread when cloning a volume

The current implementation of create_cloned_volume calls flatten
directly, and this makes whole thread of cinder-volume blocked by that
flatten call. This causes heartbeat timeout in RabbitMQ when cloning
a volume with rbd backend.

This patch makes sure that flatten is executed in a different thread,
to allow heatbeat thread to run while flattening a rbd image.

Closes-Bug: #1898918
Change-Id: I9f28260008117abcebfc96dbe69bf892f5cd14fe

commit_message:
Preparing for removal of six.reraise()

Add unit tests to make sure the behavior of two functions using
six.rereaise() will be the same once six usage is removed.

Change-Id: Ie75beeb3f52aac26757500b39b76f2811ff97ac9

commit_message:
Add p11_crypto_plugin token options

This patch adds support for two new options in the
p11_crypto_plugin section of the config file.

Depends-On: I115cf1a7006a6c85f37c5e50ded13134a3dfd1a3
Change-Id: I84b66d56a0914ea9e10eebb44c99ba2951ddba61

commit_message:
Simplify the definition of required parameters

This patch removes the redundant logics to fail when some of the
required parameters are missing, by the built-in behavior to define
required parameters.

Change-Id: Ieebd67e2551709731ebd11957d28d1762ec308d4

commit_message:
Remove six of dir cinder/image/*

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.add_metaclass
- six.text_type
- six.string_types
- six.moves
- six.reraise

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/757655

Implements: blueprint six-removal

Change-Id: I1f1728b6c98826f8702a1479cf53e05dc270a670

commit_message:
Fix wrong comments about the required parameters

Some parameters in the barbican::plugins::p11_crypto class and the
barbican::plugins::kmip class are always required when these classes
are loaded.
This patch update the description about these parameters so that it
clearly shows that they are always required.

Change-Id: Ie8f77821e5a09362972aa059ac44b45409eee3fd

[{'created': '2020-08-10 06:50:48.000000000', 'message': "Optimize volume copy logic

   when we migration, retype or backup an volume, it need to call
_transfer_data function in volume_utils.py, especially in the
RBD volume that we use a lot.

   if the volume is thin volume, and the file in the volume is sparse
file, this means it may not the end of file when we read b'',if we
break here will lead to Incomplete file,This is a serious situation
for mirror image。
   so we should not break, we should continue and seek the offset of
dest. in order to get the full data of src volume.

Closes-Bug:#1890979

Change-Id: Ic3aa3403d14647b6b0a0990f5d109c005b0c3a9e
"}, {'created': '2020-08-11 01:36:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix volume copy logic

   when we migration, retype or backup an volume, it need to call

RBD volume that we use a lot.

   if the volume is thin volume, and the file in the volume is sparse
file, this means it may not the end of file when we read b'',if we
break here will lead to Incomplete file,This is a serious situation
for mirror image。
   so we should not break, we should continue and seek the offset of
dest. in order to get the full data of src volume.

Closes-Bug:#1890979

Change-Id: Ic3aa3403d14647b6b0a0990f5d109c005b0c3a9e
"}, {'created': '2020-10-10 08:28:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix volume copy logic

   when we migration, retype or backup an volume, it need to call
_transfer_data function in volume_utils.py, especially in the
RBD volume that we use a lot.

   if the volume is thin volume, and the file in the volume is sparse
file, before we reached the end of src vol, if we get a chunk is all
made up of '\0xx', then we no need to write the chunk to dest, just
need to seek the dest, this will increase copy speed.

and add a read retry mechanism.

Closes-Bug:#1890979

commit_message:
Fix volume copy logic

   when we migration, retype or backup an volume, it need to call
_transfer_data function in volume_utils.py, especially in the
RBD volume that we use a lot.

   if the volume is thin volume, and the file in the volume is sparse
file, before we reached the end of src vol, if we get a chunk is all
made up of '\0xx', then we no need to write the chunk to dest, just
need to seek the dest, this will increase copy speed.

and add a read retry mechanism.

Closes-Bug:#1890979

Change-Id: Ic3aa3403d14647b6b0a0990f5d109c005b0c3a9e

subject: PowerMax Driver - Legacy volumes fail to live migrate

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-12 13:26:13.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - Legacy volumes fail to live migrate

The fix moves the legacy shared volume from the masking view
structure in Ocata and sooner (when SMI-S was supported) to staging
masking view(s) in Pike and later releases (U4P REST).
In Ocata, the live migration process shared the storage group,
containing the volume, among the different compute Nodes. In PIke,
we changed the masking view structure to facilitate a cleaner live
migration process where only the volume is migrated and not all the
other volumes in the storage group. The staging storage group and
masking views facilitate a seamless live migration operation in
upgraded releases.

Change-Id: I4d28d8ed2375f68eed511de5c25898362eac1def
Closes-Bug: #1867163
(cherry picked from commit 197e024747ca04daeb35a9eaa9f1350089211ea3)
(cherry picked from commit 5dd1fa9a7873052e3fd87e41b960ae4b3de2136a)
(cherry picked from commit 509ae6459cafab359b743718b2108c6d821eaf6a)
'}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Legacy volumes fail to live migrate

The fix moves the legacy shared volume from the masking view
structure in Ocata and sooner (when SMI-S was supported) to staging
masking view(s) in Pike and later releases (U4P REST).
In Ocata, the live migration process shared the storage group,
containing the volume, among the different compute Nodes. In PIke,
we changed the masking view structure to facilitate a cleaner live
migration process where only the volume is migrated and not all the
other volumes in the storage group. The staging storage group and
masking views facilitate a seamless live migration operation in
upgraded releases.

Change-Id: I4d28d8ed2375f68eed511de5c25898362eac1def
Closes-Bug: #1867163
(cherry picked from commit 197e024747ca04daeb35a9eaa9f1350089211ea3)
(cherry picked from commit 5dd1fa9a7873052e3fd87e41b960ae4b3de2136a)
(cherry picked from commit 509ae6459cafab359b743718b2108c6d821eaf6a)

Hi Andrei,

The code and the 3rd party CI LGTM.

It's still missing the support matrix, but you can add it in a separate patch.

Also, it's good to have tempest.conf file uploaded among other log files. It's not mandatory, and it's possible to guess its contents from local.conf, but it makes easier to debug things when something unexpected happens.

Also, you might want to improve the unit test coverage for these files:

commit_message:
Add Cinder driver for Open-E JovianDSS data storage

Added support of Open-E JovianDSS data storage.
Driver supports Open-E disaster recovery feature and cascade volume
deletion in addition to all required functions.

Implements: bp open-e-joviandss-driver

Change-Id: I72513ec2100f1f4cb7e3fdb57e69243aa01dba38

Apparently the change breaks bfv for x86, from a quick peek I think this is not the right path. For a better understanding on this proposal I feel like a spec is required, or you can also raise it in the ironic weekly meeting.'}, {'account_id': 22997, 'date': '2020-10-27 02:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There should not be much cpu arch difference for BFV. Will fix the zuul test failed cases after the ironic team knows this RFE clear and no objection. 

This is one BFV spec[1], if necessary, adding one more PXE BFV scenario should be fine.

The main differences as descripted on RFE: "Regarding to booting flow, for PXE + iSCSI boot, due to there is no iSCSI connectivity in PXE as iPXE, it will need to PXE boot into kernel/initrd and then login the iSCSI volume. Also PXE doesn't fill iBFT, instead it passes iscsi username, password etc info through kernel cmdline. These are the main differences with iPXE + iSCSI boot." 
I also added two slides comparing PXE and iPXE iSCSI boot on the RFE comment. Please read them for more details, thanks.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/ironic-specs/blob/master/specs/approved/boot-from-volume-reference-drivers.rst
[2]: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008023'}, {'account_id': 22997, 'date': '2020-10-27 02:36:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

And the difference between iPXE iSCSI boot and PXE iSCSI boot is mainly on the outside of Ironic, in the Ironic side there is nearly no difference.'}, {'account_id': 22997, 'date': '2020-10-27 10:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Apparently the change breaks bfv for x86, from a quick peek I think
 > this is not the right path. For a better understanding on this
 > proposal I feel like a spec is required, or you can also raise it
 > in the ironic weekly meeting.

Add PXE boot from iSCSI volume scenario in BFV spec.

commit_message:
Add uefi pxe iscsi boot

For PXE iSCSI boot, only root partition user image support.
Cache kernel and initrd and pass iSCSI login infro through cmdline.

This patch also changes linuxefi/initrdefi to linux/initrd, so that
the grub.cfg could be used at other arch such as aarch64.

TODO:
1, Documentation
2, Unit test

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/746626/

Change-Id: I0f8a85d498813f81ffcd2697ecd96fb449e50b91
Story: #2008023

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-11 02:08:14.000000000', 'message': 'Delete unused parameter in update_single_status_where

The update_single_status_where function is only called by revert_to_snapshot.
And filters parameter in this function has not been used yet, so we should
delete it.

Change-Id: I8049a11a01548ef7283578ffc2ce4f82da79212c
'}]
commit_message:
Delete unused parameter in update_single_status_where

The update_single_status_where function is only called by revert_to_snapshot.
And filters parameter in this function has not been used yet, so we should
delete it.

Change-Id: I8049a11a01548ef7283578ffc2ce4f82da79212c

commit_message:
Remove six of dir cinder/tests/unit/backup/*

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.PY2
- six.PY3
- six.moves
- six.text_type

Change-Id: I262e5156ee730faefe55b8b25bf7541643e6df39
Implements: blueprint six-removal

* Seagate-FC http://os-logs.tristero.net/seagate-ci/756616-5/Seagate-FC : SUCCESS in 38:18.41'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-10-10 02:16:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

For most of these files, you're importing the entire http.client, whereas all we really want are the status codes.  Instead, you can do:

from http import HTTPStatus

You could do 'from http import HTTPStatus as http_client', but I think that would be misleading, it would be better to make the explicit change to HTTPStatus.OK, etc."}, {'account_id': 24814, 'date': '2020-10-10 05:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

* HPMSA-iSCSI http://os-logs.tristero.net/hpemsa-ci/756616-5/HPMSA-iSCSI : SUCCESS in 53:57.04
* HPMSA-FC http://os-logs.tristero.net/hpemsa-ci/756616-5/HPMSA-FC : SUCCESS in 35:34.35'}, {'account_id': 30092, 'date': '2020-10-10 06:53:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> For most of these files, you're importing the entire http.client,
 > whereas all we really want are the status codes.  Instead, you can
 > do:
 > 
 > from http import HTTPStatus
 > 
 > You could do 'from http import HTTPStatus as http_client', but I
 > think that would be misleading, it would be better to make the
 > explicit change to HTTPStatus.OK, etc.

OK, thanks very much."}, {'account_id': 30092, 'date': '2020-10-10 06:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24921, 'date': '2020-10-10 07:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Remove six of dir cinder/tests/unit/api/*

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.moves
- six.PY3
- six.PY2
- six.text_type
- six.string_types
- six.unichr
- six.viewkeys

Change-Id: I7f701dd1e5f8cb220b08191101589858f8232178
Implements: blueprint six-removal

Remove six in files under cinder/*

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.add_metaclass
- six.PY2
- six.text_type
- six.string_types
- six.wraps

commit_message:
Splits kuryr-controller and kuryr-cni ServiceAccounts

The same ServiceAccount was used for kuryr-controller and kuryr-cni.
This change splits the ServiceAccount, generates two ServiceAccounts,
controller_service_account.yaml and cni_service_account.yaml and
applies them.The documentation, Kuryr installation as kubernetes addon
network addon was also updated to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I567aaa38f5498af4641e06002b808915dd467aec
Closes-Bug: #1764783

commit_message:
Remove six of dir cinder/backup/*

Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.

- six.add_metaclass
- six.PY3
- six.text_type
- six.moves
- six.BytesIO
- six.string_types

Implements: blueprint six-removal

Change-Id: Ic3350bf354556d86fe40d9831db07b1378a9790e

commit_message:
Fix service_get_log tests

Regarding Elod's comment in 924f3a4fa8d84c4d82151888dbbf51d665d4d860 the
tests seem to be invalid and need to be updated.

Change-Id: I633e67efa4869816786011c3d093dc81e177010c
(cherry picked from commit d680a237e8f80f182c9a3445a7a8e0f4f4d0bd61)

commit_message:
Critical fix for MSA 2060 and MSA 1060

Correct omission in HPE MSA driver doc and fix driver failures caused
by use of deprecated API command syntax that's not accepted by the
latest firmware.  The changes are conditional on the firmware version
so that arrays with older firmware will not be affected.

Change-Id: I73b093bcee4ac83cb80480097818b28104f8e15f
Closes-Bug: #1897926
(cherry picked from commit d739b867144f5b5069ad7ef357eb74ccb02149ad)

commit_message:
Disallow extension of attached volumes for NFS & Quobyte drivers

NFS and Quobyte drivers no longer allow extension of an attached
volume. The extend operation raises an ExtendVolumeError
in the Cinder Volume service in case the volume to be extended
is currently attached.

This should be reverted once a a more capable solution for
bug #1870367 has been found.

Partial-bug: #1870367

Change-Id: Ib2a7c1cdf269b4907ff8adff1b9d900072eedde2
(cherry picked from commit 57892623dee9d64c0ac52e2830ff28b866f10d65)

- six.add_metaclass

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-06 09:05:00.000000000', 'message': 'Backup: Fix formatting errors

There are a couple of places in the Backup manager where we are passing
a set instead of a dictionary to LOG.warning, which leads to an error:

  TypeError: not all arguments converted during string formatting

This patch converts those sets into dicts, as they were intended.

Closes-Bug: #1898621
Change-Id: I33c5ee005f23ed05bf93b9137000b28c3df7b7b2
'}]
commit_message:
Backup: Fix formatting errors

There are a couple of places in the Backup manager where we are passing
a set instead of a dictionary to LOG.warning, which leads to an error:

  TypeError: not all arguments converted during string formatting

This patch converts those sets into dicts, as they were intended.

Closes-Bug: #1898621
Change-Id: I33c5ee005f23ed05bf93b9137000b28c3df7b7b2

commit_message:
Fix heat container mounts

We need to mount in the api-paste.ini in order to have the container
actually work.

Change-Id: I3b573076afb43f294c09dc5e40cefd82068e0d84
Blueprint: bp/switch-to-heat-all-container

subject: Correct the validate_selinux working_dir
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-27 06:29:38.000000000', 'message': "Correct the validate_selinux working_dir

This change reflects what was previously done in tripleo-validations
with Ib125ca44f7e3d7fed1d19d2b1847b5bbe64226ed.

Apparently those changes merged a bit after the validation was moved,
meaning we're still pointing to the wrong location here.

Since validations-common is branchless, we don't need to backport
things, but a new tag will be needed in order to include this change
in downstream OSP-16.1.

Change-Id: Ib234917ca74ac3398af7603e4be1d9e2e126de41
Closes-Bug: #1892356
Resolves: rhbz#1876040
"}]
commit_message:
Correct the validate_selinux working_dir

This change reflects what was previously done in tripleo-validations
with Ib125ca44f7e3d7fed1d19d2b1847b5bbe64226ed.

Apparently those changes merged a bit after the validation was moved,
meaning we're still pointing to the wrong location here.

Since validations-common is branchless, we don't need to backport
things, but a new tag will be needed in order to include this change
in downstream OSP-16.1.

Change-Id: Ib234917ca74ac3398af7603e4be1d9e2e126de41
Closes-Bug: #1892356
Resolves: rhbz#1876040

commit_message:
Critical fix for MSA 2060 and MSA 1060

Correct omission in HPE MSA driver doc and fix driver failures caused
by use of deprecated API command syntax that's not accepted by the
latest firmware.  The changes are conditional on the firmware version
so that arrays with older firmware will not be affected.

Change-Id: I73b093bcee4ac83cb80480097818b28104f8e15f
Closes-Bug: #1897926

commit_message:
[ussuri] Migrate to content provider jobs/template

This change migrate c8 jobs/templates to content provider
jobs so consumer jobs can use resources built by provider
jobs.

Change-Id: I1a3558d3c86bef794a9864d880f6b11952558914
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix get/update/delete of non-OVN agents

At some point, KeyError stopped being raised by get_agent and
instead the AgentNotFound exception. This meant that the patched
plugin methods would not be called for {get,update,delete}_agent
calls for non-OVN agents.

Change-Id: Id755a9eec08414d7a77e67a426d7796fae693ac7
Closes-Bug: #1895033

commit_message:
[ussuri] Migrate to content provider jobs/templates

This change migrate c8 jobs/templates to content provider
jos so consumer jobs can use resources built by provider
jobs.

Change-Id: I26c11b6512725c0f0b5ce6b24d7ca489b97abce6
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-23 16:45:30.000000000', 'message': 'Skip tripleo_lvmfilter unless enabled or dry_run is set

This is to address the concerns raised in [1]; it skips the role
execution unless the feature is either explicitly enabled or the
caller has set dry_run variable which will make it run up to the
creation of the new lvm.conf file but not actually copy it into
place.

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697990/49/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_lvmfilter/tasks/main.yml

commit_message:
Skip tripleo_lvmfilter unless enabled or dry_run is set

This is to address the concerns raised in [1]; it skips the role
execution unless the feature is either explicitly enabled or the
caller has set dry_run variable which will make it run up to the
creation of the new lvm.conf file but not actually copy it into
place.

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697990/49/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_lvmfilter/tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I1c914feda3c4b1bfb6dcfd981244477f82915b75

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-01 14:29:42.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - Legacy volumes fail to live migrate

The fix moves the legacy shared volume from the masking view
structure in Ocata and sooner (when SMI-S was supported) to staging
masking view(s) in Pike and later releases (U4P REST).
In Ocata, the live migration process shared the storage group,
containing the volume, among the different compute Nodes. In PIke,
we changed the masking view structure to facilitate a cleaner live
migration process where only the volume is migrated and not all the
other volumes in the storage group. The staging storage group and
masking views facilitate a seamless live migration operation in
upgraded releases.

Change-Id: I4d28d8ed2375f68eed511de5c25898362eac1def
Closes-Bug: #1867163
(cherry picked from commit 197e024747ca04daeb35a9eaa9f1350089211ea3)
(cherry picked from commit 5dd1fa9a7873052e3fd87e41b960ae4b3de2136a)
'}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Legacy volumes fail to live migrate

The fix moves the legacy shared volume from the masking view
structure in Ocata and sooner (when SMI-S was supported) to staging
masking view(s) in Pike and later releases (U4P REST).
In Ocata, the live migration process shared the storage group,
containing the volume, among the different compute Nodes. In PIke,
we changed the masking view structure to facilitate a cleaner live
migration process where only the volume is migrated and not all the
other volumes in the storage group. The staging storage group and
masking views facilitate a seamless live migration operation in
upgraded releases.

Change-Id: I4d28d8ed2375f68eed511de5c25898362eac1def
Closes-Bug: #1867163
(cherry picked from commit 197e024747ca04daeb35a9eaa9f1350089211ea3)
(cherry picked from commit 5dd1fa9a7873052e3fd87e41b960ae4b3de2136a)

commit_message:
revert libvirt-python upper-constraints bump to 6.8.0

Partial revert of change I1bc1fe988e3cfd4824dd7b4a9327a67db46c1533
suspected of breaking nova-compute with:

File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/eventlet/tpool.py", line 149, in proxy_call
  if isinstance(rv, autowrap):
File "/usr/lib/python3.6/typing.py", line 1162, in __instancecheck__
return issubclass(instance.__class__, self)
File "/usr/lib/python3.6/typing.py", line 1148, in __subclasscheck__
  raise TypeError("Parameterized generics cannot be used with class "
TypeError: Parameterized generics cannot be used with class or instance checks

Related-Bug: #1901383
Change-Id: I5990b00f94305813780854698fef2d3e1e721e79

(4 comments)

Thanks for the review Brian.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-05-01 21:52:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

We need to discuss this.  I think restricting the attachment-get to admin only may be overly restrictive and interfere with some functionality.  Besides, all the information (except for the attached_host) is being displayed in the volume-show call, so there's another way to access it.  Further, it's kind of weird to allow all attachment API operations to the volume owner except reading.  I think we want to hide only the attachment_host field, not the entire attachment detail response.  But I'm not sure it makes sense to have a configurable policy just for that single field.  The other open question is whether any consumer of the attachments API, which I guess is Nova and maybe Glance via the cinder glance_store, needs to know the attachment_host to perform current operations.  (Nova should have another way to know what host a volume is being attached to, not sure about other use cases.)"}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2020-05-01 22:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Introduce new policy for attachment get

With the attachment get JSON response, we get a lot of information
that might not be useful (or probably dangerous) for non-admins.
This patch introduces two new attachment policies that will hide the
connection info for non-admins.

Change-Id: I3d097410f57828ae81ba4ee1fdd2244811d7e0b1
Closes-Bug: #1736773

commit_message:
Work around broken json parsing in latest pygments

In version 2.7.0 pygments contains this change[0] to be stricter
when parsing json, breaking highlighting for some of our samples.
This patch fixes the json examples.

[0] https://github.com/pygments/pygments/commit/9514e794e0c2a5c7c048df97fcfef4a099e05ac3

Change-Id: I59adc546dbf8079bd5cc3aab4a1500360649d210

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix extend volume for iSCSI/FCP

Due to a characteristic on ONTAP devices, the volume extend
operation has a max resize size limited by underlying LUN's
geometry, so the support for extend online volumes was
disabled.

This patch fixes it by allowing a volume (attached or not)
to be extended up to 16TB, which is the max LUN size
supported by ONTAP.

NFS online_extend_support is still disabled due to a bug [0]
found on the generic implementation for NFS driver, which
ONTAP NFS driver relies on.

Closes-Bug: #1874134

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1870367

Change-Id: I2812d71b23f27fe8be4e9a757094867f71b1afa2
(cherry picked from commit 510613e135b639776246d46c3d7977208d0fbfd8)
(cherry picked from commit 8c55df95dc8f8997d0391f789e0461a48d601fde)

[{'account_id': 32073, 'date': '2020-08-07 07:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-08-07 07:05:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 32073, 'date': '2020-08-07 07:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2020-08-07 08:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
[SVF]:changes in create_group_from_src for replicated groups

IBM Spectrum Virtualize Family: Code changes to make create_group_from_src
work for replication_enabled or snapshot_enabled consistency groups.

Change-Id: Ic71f5d934ee8169536d0aeda1e93269f18448339

commit_message:
Use lxc_image_cache_server_mirrors as image source

Because of ubuntu has dropped their LTS base images and
Centos does not ship not docker layered images,
we decided to return back to use default LXC images
by default. In the meanwhile, in case deployer
defined lxc_hosts_container_image_url - this url will
have prescedence and URL detection will not happen.

Closes-Bug: #1900884
Closes-Bug: #1900975

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/759498
Change-Id: Ib926e930ba105eeb49b7cf0031c77c7dc4c97b62

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-26 11:27:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling of previous request

The interface used to track the previous request by keeping a
copy in the ops db using self._stored.broker_req. But every time
the charm adds an op to the broker request self._stored.broker_req
is updated, so the self._stored.broker_req no longer matches what
the charm sent down the relation at the end of the last hook
execution. To fix this the interface now loads all existing
broker requests into self.previous_requests which is a dictionary
keyed on the request id. The interface can then build up the
new request using self.new_request. Because the interface has
no explicit commit or send method the interface can never know
when an op is added whether its the final op of the request so
it updates the relation every time an op is added. If
self.new_request is functionally equivalent to the previous
request in self.previous_requests then the previous request
is restored to ensure that the hook execution is a noop from
a relation data perspective.

Drive by fixes included:

* self.model is an alias for self.framework.model so use it.
* remove calls to self.model.get_relation as it explodes
  when there are multiple ceph-client relations.

Depends-On: I07bb4f92bb12708a4679cb84d73cb7ed177fdca8
Change-Id: I3953d28029d6daa6d771617c596a6e75fbacf258
'}, {'created': '2020-10-27 17:32:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling of previous request

The interface used to track the previous request by keeping a
copy in the ops db using self._stored.broker_req. But every time
the charm adds an op to the broker request self._stored.broker_req
is updated, so the self._stored.broker_req no longer matches what
the charm sent down the relation at the end of the last hook
execution. To fix this the interface now loads all existing
broker requests into self.previous_requests which is a dictionary
keyed on the request id. The interface can then build up the
new request using self.new_request. Because the interface has
no explicit commit or send method the interface can never know
when an op is added whether its the final op of the request so
it updates the relation every time an op is added. If
self.new_request is functionally equivalent to the previous
request in self.previous_requests then the previous request
is restored to ensure that the hook execution is a noop from
a relation data perspective.

Drive by fixes included:

* self.model is an alias for self.framework.model so use it.
* remove calls to self.model.get_relation as it explodes
  when there are multiple ceph-client relations.

Depends-On: I07bb4f92bb12708a4679cb84d73cb7ed177fdca8
Change-Id: I3953d28029d6daa6d771617c596a6e75fbacf258
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of previous request

The interface used to track the previous request by keeping a
copy in the ops db using self._stored.broker_req. But every time
the charm adds an op to the broker request self._stored.broker_req
is updated, so the self._stored.broker_req no longer matches what
the charm sent down the relation at the end of the last hook
execution. To fix this the interface now loads all existing
broker requests into self.previous_requests which is a dictionary
keyed on the request id. The interface can then build up the
new request using self.new_request. Because the interface has
no explicit commit or send method the interface can never know
when an op is added whether its the final op of the request so
it updates the relation every time an op is added. If
self.new_request is functionally equivalent to the previous
request in self.previous_requests then the previous request
is restored to ensure that the hook execution is a noop from
a relation data perspective.

Drive by fixes included:

* self.model is an alias for self.framework.model so use it.
* remove calls to self.model.get_relation as it explodes
  when there are multiple ceph-client relations.

Depends-On: I07bb4f92bb12708a4679cb84d73cb7ed177fdca8
Change-Id: I3953d28029d6daa6d771617c596a6e75fbacf258

[{'created': '2020-10-24 19:02:18.000000000', 'message': "Only purge docker when using podman

If you define both the docker and podman services, during the upgrade

commit_message:
Only purge docker when using podman

If you define both the docker and podman services, during the upgrade
the podman service nukes docker even if we have container_cli set to
docker. This change skips docker purge if we're configured to use
docker.

Change-Id: Ib6db467f292d61299ecd9b0dff6c334028b80181
Related-Bug: #1901209

commit_message:
Remove the wrongly placed release note file

The previous change[1] migrated the release note file to the correct
place, but this caused that the old release notes migrated from
manifests directory appear in the latest release note[2].
This patch remove that file to get rid of these confusing contents.

[1] 671f9e4dbf0b74efe31e8f1c2cf40fd4f7291518
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/puppet-nova/unreleased.html

Change-Id: I3d878ab0fef196579c86e03f422dd652f2f124c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-12 07:37:56.000000000', 'message': 'Force CephAnsiblePlaybook to its default value on FFU prepare

There is code in tripleo-ansible [1] which will look at if user
customized the CephAnsiblePlaybook to run and, if so, will always
use that instead of the special playbook we intend to use on
_systemd or _fstobs tags.

This change will reset param value to its default on FFU
prepare so that we actually trigger the special playbooks later
on in the process, whichever custom setting operators might
have set via CephAnsiblePlaybook param for their Queens deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1898589

1. https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_run_ansible/tasks/main.yml#L19

commit_message:
Force CephAnsiblePlaybook to its default value on FFU prepare

There is code in tripleo-ansible [1] which will look at if user
customized the CephAnsiblePlaybook to run and, if so, will always
use that instead of the special playbook we intend to use on
_systemd or _fstobs tags.

This change will reset param value to its default on FFU
prepare so that we actually trigger the special playbooks later
on in the process, whichever custom setting operators might
have set via CephAnsiblePlaybook param for their Queens deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1898589

1. https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_run_ansible/tasks/main.yml#L19

Change-Id: If3c0e12181bb926125eb8aa1014db35ed111ca35
(cherry picked from commit aafb509618b1c181b5eb373fabe510cad9ba8c8b)

Refactor custom status checks

Refactor custom status checks to allow the charm specific class and
the inherited general charm type classes to specify status checks.

commit_message:
Updates vagrant README

The vagrant-devstack-Kuryr-Kubernetes 'Vagrant Options available' in
the README stated that the default VAGRANT_KURYR_VM_MEMORY is 4096,
this change updates it to 6144. And mentions that for a lighter
devstack installation ovn and ovn-octavia driver can be used.
This change also updates the url for atlas.

Change-Id: Idb20cc2c89043a2aaf13335aec44acced283baf4
Closes-Bug: 1901558

http://paste.openstack.org/show/799335/'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-10-23 18:16:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-10-23 18:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Hm, I thought this issue was fixed by streaming raw images with the direct deploy interface in Ironic.

+2 But adding dtantsur to review.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-10-26 08:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-10-26 12:50:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hm, I thought this issue was fixed by streaming raw images with the
 > direct deploy interface in Ironic.
 > 
 > +2 But adding dtantsur to review.

My UC is 12 days old.  If there's a link to the fixing patch I can check if I have it. Here's my ironic.conf

[CentOS-8.2 - root@undercloud ironic]# pwd
/var/lib/config-data/ironic/etc/ironic
[CentOS-8.2 - root@undercloud ironic]# cat ironic.conf | grep -v \# | egrep -v "^$" | curl -F 'f:1=<-' ix.io
http://ix.io/2C6i
[CentOS-8.2 - root@undercloud ironic]#'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-10-27 15:56:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

I've got 4 +2s so I'm going to merge this docs patch so users know. If we find out more I can do another docs patch."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-23 18:04:03.000000000', 'message': 'Document that >4 GB of RAM is necessary with metalsmith

This may be a side effiect of using direct raw images. I
found I was unable to provision unless I deployoed with
5 GB of RAM so we should warn people.

Change-Id: Ifd44599df29c2b0f792043cf3c9620fcdc5fca5f
'}]
commit_message:
Document that >4 GB of RAM is necessary with metalsmith

This may be a side effiect of using direct raw images. I
found I was unable to provision unless I deployoed with
5 GB of RAM so we should warn people.

Change-Id: Ifd44599df29c2b0f792043cf3c9620fcdc5fca5f

subject: Don't give up when an Exception happens in idl.run
messages: [{'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2020-10-26 11:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-10-26 11:58:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-10-27 14:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-26 11:24:44.000000000', 'message': "Don't give up when an Exception happens in idl.run

It's possible that idl.run() could have a bug where it raises an
Exception for an extended period of time while ovsdb-server is
down, but recover once ovsdb-server comes back up. Specifically,
python-ovs currently doesn't properly catch an exception when the
socket type is 'ssl' that it catches for other protocols.

Change-Id: Ia068650d2db3d5d8642771a6df5a260d692aea20
Closes-Bug: #1895727
(cherry picked from commit 83cf7aa6c81f1b2341b2bba1fe156047fa5d29f6)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't give up when an Exception happens in idl.run

It's possible that idl.run() could have a bug where it raises an
Exception for an extended period of time while ovsdb-server is
down, but recover once ovsdb-server comes back up. Specifically,
python-ovs currently doesn't properly catch an exception when the
socket type is 'ssl' that it catches for other protocols.

Change-Id: Ia068650d2db3d5d8642771a6df5a260d692aea20
Closes-Bug: #1895727
(cherry picked from commit 83cf7aa6c81f1b2341b2bba1fe156047fa5d29f6)

subject: Fix database migrations and disable the non-standalone job
messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-10-27 07:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-10-27 07:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-27 07:49:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix database migrations and disable the non-standalone job

The pattern of adding a column and then reading a table with it
no longer works in SQLAlchemy 1.3.20. This has been reported
upstream [1] and apparently we're doing the wrong thing by reusing
a column object twice.

We need to disable the non-standalone job since it's really broken
now, and this fix is blocking bifrost.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/5669

Change-Id: I2fb07413e8f421f39b24acf1272771ee2097b195
(cherry picked from commit 5678f219cd55345633c1478c3cad22460bef4429)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix database migrations and disable the non-standalone job

The pattern of adding a column and then reading a table with it
no longer works in SQLAlchemy 1.3.20. This has been reported
upstream [1] and apparently we're doing the wrong thing by reusing
a column object twice.

We need to disable the non-standalone job since it's really broken
now, and this fix is blocking bifrost.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/5669

Change-Id: I2fb07413e8f421f39b24acf1272771ee2097b195
(cherry picked from commit 5678f219cd55345633c1478c3cad22460bef4429)

commit_message:
Fix issue in case unknown location is provided

Using the "location" command to point to an unknown location
would cause the Javascript displaying the schedule to crash.

It's a bit useless to use that command in a virtual PTG with
meeting URLs, however the page should handle that case and fail
more gracefully.

Change-Id: I271e2ead0094d407274cbb22e499d7b2c49631b4

commit_message:
Support more parameters for ipmi driver

This patch adds several parameters to the ironic::driver::ipmi class,
so that puppet-ironic supports more parameters for ipmi driver.

Note that additional_retryable_ipmi_errors is not added by this patch
since we need to replace ini provider by ruby provider to support
MultiStrOpt.

Change-Id: Ia166084ac8d0927db9461e43099275ba1d4c20ed

commit_message:

stable/victoria.

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

commit_message:
[train and before] Define default firewall_driver value

no-op-firewall-nova-driver validation fails if firewall_driver is
not defined in nova.conf. At the same time, default definition is
also OK and validation should pass if firewall_driver is not
defined.

The no-op-firewall-nova-driver validation was removed during Ussuri
cycle[1] so this change is submitted to train and older branches

[1] f1963a4e8396c9b833619e57d4b9509af887c2b0

Closes-Bug: #1901302
Related: rhbz#1891204
Change-Id: I5bf05356bc2bda6ede2df6f7688c2c5e2f46f20e

commit_message:
Pin virtualenv<20 for python2 functional tests

The functional tests break [1] wth versions of virtualenv 20 or greater
so pin the version on stable branches so that tests keep working.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/798877/

Change-Id: Ie9c677933364afc9b3ea1821ee9f0d70589c5683
(cherry picked from commit 81f3860251a9cda01a5aee3baf40713e16d80c0e)

An empty physical_network can be set to port and make the port
unusable.

Story: 2008279
Task: 41153

commit_message:
Validation_name must be a list, and we must not pass .yaml

With the recent changes in the validation framework libs (mainly
validations-libs), we must pass a list of validation, and we must pass
only the validation name, without any extension.

Change-Id: I6baab18e70b77d7fab95668a8b8e4207d75373b1
Closes-Bug: #1901676

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-17 09:42:06.000000000', 'message': "Python 3.9: use base64.{decode,encode}bytes

The functions base64.decodestring / encodestring are removed from
Python 3.9, therefore we must switch to the non deprecated alias.
Note that the {decode,encode}bytes have been around for a long time
so it's not an issue.

Change-Id: I51d2654e5952eccf7894b7e2ecb61a0c19dabe02
"}]
commit_message:
Python 3.9: use base64.{decode,encode}bytes

The functions base64.decodestring / encodestring are removed from
Python 3.9, therefore we must switch to the non deprecated alias.
Note that the {decode,encode}bytes have been around for a long time
so it's not an issue.

Change-Id: I51d2654e5952eccf7894b7e2ecb61a0c19dabe02

messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-10-26 22:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-10-27 12:45:57.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nSuperceeded by Riccardo's updated move to ubuntu focal patch."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-26 22:19:26.000000000', 'message': "Extend memory alloc for IPA jobs

For some reason, while the centos image has
shrunk by 1MB, and Cirros is only 16MB, and
the job console log is noting 380-something
MB of memory freed after ramdisk load, we're
still running out of memory.

So increase the memory a little, and hopefully
increase our job success rate.

Change-Id: Ide7d1895bcff586f770443019af7cacacbbe918e
"}]
commit_message:
Extend memory alloc for IPA jobs

For some reason, while the centos image has
shrunk by 1MB, and Cirros is only 16MB, and
the job console log is noting 380-something
MB of memory freed after ramdisk load, we're
still running out of memory.

So increase the memory a little, and hopefully
increase our job success rate.

Change-Id: Ide7d1895bcff586f770443019af7cacacbbe918e

subject: [DNM] testing RHEL8
messages:
[{'account_id': 20363, 'date': '2020-10-21 06:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-10-21 06:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/devstack on branch stable/train.  The error was:

  The nodeset "openstack-two-node-bionic" was not found.

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: devstack-multinode
      parent: devstack
      nodeset: openstack-two-node-bionic
      description: |
        Simple multinode test to verify multinode functionality on devstack side.
        This is not meant to be used as a parent job.

  in "openstack/devstack/.zuul.yaml@stable/train", line 502, column 3'}, {'account_id': 20363, 'date': '2020-10-21 06:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-10-21 06:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

repo openstack/devstack on branch stable/train.  The error was:

  The nodeset "openstack-two-node-bionic" was not found.

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: devstack-multinode
      parent: devstack
      nodeset: openstack-two-node-bionic
      description: |
        Simple multinode test to verify multinode functionality on devstack side.
        This is not meant to be used as a parent job.

  in "openstack/devstack/.zuul.yaml@stable/train", line 502, column 3'}, {'account_id': 20363, 'date': '2020-10-27 11:31:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix restoring listener in case of removing NP.

In case of using amphora with Octavia, and network policy, which
blocking the traffic within the namespace, LB listener was set to
offline state. After removal of the NP, listener state still was
offline. In this patch we fix that case.

Change-Id: I406cdc7d368122c6f828e9fa481d267e56b22ca6
Closes-Bug: 1899148

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Iab01a9be7bfeb30842189b62b681fd42c2a69d30
Sem-Ver: feature

Starting with Ansible 2.9.10, the "Collecting node facts" task in
bifrost-configdrives-dynamic can fail because it tries to SSH to
localhost, which may not be possible in some environments, such as

'}]
commit_message:
Force local connection for localhost

Starting with Ansible 2.9.10, the "Collecting node facts" task in
bifrost-configdrives-dynamic can fail because it tries to SSH to
localhost, which may not be possible in some environments, such as
Bifrost deployed as a container by Kolla.

Change-Id: I1ed19e325db9396ff6b250e14c967ce90c785201
Story: 2008260
Task: 41118
(cherry picked from commit a6c56c6647fbf14f68ecbceec1b5fc70423a1314)

commit_message:
Improve configurability of Tempest tests

Adds basic support for configuring various parts of the tests to
make it easier to use them in environments which are configured
differently to DevStack. Specifically in this case the motivation
is to run the Monasca Tempest tests in Kolla CI.

This should be a NOOP change for existing environments.

Change-Id: If6be3a4d54a7b10c3ff40f9ed34045c50ffc3bae

commit_message:
Remove the wrongly placed release note file

The previous change[1] migrated the release note file to the correct
place, but this caused that the old release notes migrated from
manifests directory appear in the latest release note[2].
This patch remove that file to get rid of these confusing contents.

[1] 02d0fea8296b59236a9d0d93ebdec8c9467dd8eb
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/puppet-ironic/unreleased.html

Change-Id: I28e4c0edca618556be287185c6bcb447365e8744

commit_message:
Remove the wrongly placed release note file

The previous change[1] migrated the release note file to the correct
place, but this caused that the old release notes migrated from
manifests directory appear in the latest release note[2].
This patch remove that file to get rid of these confusing contents.

[1] ab9b3a9e465f8b17e456e71b80f2b64dbb186630
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/puppet-cinder/unreleased.html

Change-Id: I68fe87f60870bb2c4fa683bfcbbc84abd306666e

commit_message:
Use low-memory-usage.yaml in tripleo jobs

low-memory-usage.yaml is generally used in TripleO standalone jobs now,
thus it is better to enable it in TripleO jobs in each puppet modules.

Change-Id: I40145696225bda8ab2b229148a5fbec9249df7e0

commit_message:
Enable hostname change for db users

This commit is to enable configuration of hostname
for db users, this helps in restricting access for
unmatched hosts.

This also adds a gate check for the same.

Change-Id: Ia041753e87e8d5ddce1e8e6e71fd5bb0ed156794

commit_message:
Enable hostname change for db users

This commit is to enable configuration of hostname
for db users in openstack services db init, this
helps in restricting access for unmatched hosts.
This also adds a gate check for the same.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739015/

Change-Id: I4f111e51ea640d22d1e00c8a1a940b4e17dbe9a1

commit_message:
Corrected work directory for validate-selinux

the /var/log/validations directory doesn't exist on the overcloud, since
we don't install the validations there.

Closes-Bug: #745299
Change-Id: Ib125ca44f7e3d7fed1d19d2b1847b5bbe64226ed
(cherry picked from commit 9645db1f74b2052ca009767b3f85642dd1e6e49f)
(cherry picked from commit 70b766c2f9240e75d0c62f791d47d24d8fad0a31)

[ussuri] Migrate to content provider jobs/templates

This change migrate c8 jobs/templates to content provider
jos so consumer jobs can use resources built by provider
jobs.

In other words, super() is enough for most cases.

Let's enable 'super-with-arguments' check.

commit_message:
Use python3-style super()

In python3, super() does not always require a class and self reference.
In other words, super() is enough for most cases.
This is much simpler and it is time to switch it to the newer style.

pylint provides a check for this.
Let's enable 'super-with-arguments' check.

NOTE: _prepare_mappings() method of FormRegion in
openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/regions/forms.py is refactored.
super() (without explicit class and self referece) does not work when
a subclass method calls a same method in a parent class multiple times.
It looks better to prepare a separate method to provide a common logic.

Change-Id: Id9512a14be9f20dbd5ebd63d446570c7b7c825ff

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: Iadf4581646131f87803c2cebbc66bd55fdb56685

commit_message:
Python 3.9: base64.{en,de}codestring function is removed

We must use base64.{en,de}codebytes instead, which has been around for a
very long time already.

Change-Id: I7f4d522b4b1c32c1d338aba8076b0aa89c82181b

[{'created': '2020-09-11 14:18:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Ie61484159d327a60c377b5465ef4faabac8a553d
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Pull non-tripleo containers from different registries

tripleo containers are built using ubi8 base image in the content
provider job itself so we donot need to pull them.

We need to think about pulling non-tripleo containers.

Since we are moving away from docker.io and switching to quay.io.
What if quay.io also went down then we need a failover strategy.

In order to implement that, we started pulling containers from
Quay first then fallback to rdo registry, if that also falls
then switch to docker.io.

If all fails, then fail the job.

Change-Id: I3e1504c66a861aeb375b190301bd49a5f2c66e95
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-10-13 14:58:05.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tap interface with multiqueue

When vif_type="tap" (such as when using calico),
attempting to create an instance using an image that has
the property hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=True fails, because
the interface is always being created without multiqueue
flags.

This change checks if the property is defined and passes
the multiqueue parameter to create the tap interface
accordingly.

In case the multiqueue parameter is passed but the
vif_model is not virtio (or unspecified), the old
behavior is maintained.

Conflicts:
  nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py

NOTE: The conflict is for not having change
Iab16a15a5f141a7f7aae4172b092c50ee7964597 in stable/stein.

Change-Id: I0307c43dcd0cace1620d2ac75925651d4ee2e96c
Closes-bug: #1893263
(cherry picked from commit 84cfc8e9ab1396ec17abcfc9646c7d40f1d966ae)
(cherry picked from commit a69845f3732843ee1451b2e4ebf547d9801e898d)
(cherry picked from commit 750655c19daf4e8d0dcf35d3b1cab5e6d8ac69ba)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tap interface with multiqueue

When vif_type="tap" (such as when using calico),
attempting to create an instance using an image that has
the property hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=True fails, because
the interface is always being created without multiqueue
flags.

This change checks if the property is defined and passes
the multiqueue parameter to create the tap interface
accordingly.

In case the multiqueue parameter is passed but the
vif_model is not virtio (or unspecified), the old
behavior is maintained.

Conflicts:
  nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py

NOTE: The conflict is for not having change
Iab16a15a5f141a7f7aae4172b092c50ee7964597 in stable/stein.

Change-Id: I0307c43dcd0cace1620d2ac75925651d4ee2e96c
Closes-bug: #1893263
(cherry picked from commit 84cfc8e9ab1396ec17abcfc9646c7d40f1d966ae)
(cherry picked from commit a69845f3732843ee1451b2e4ebf547d9801e898d)
(cherry picked from commit 750655c19daf4e8d0dcf35d3b1cab5e6d8ac69ba)

Use libvirt/cpu_models

The directive libvirt/cpu_model is deprecated in the favor of
libvirt/cpu_models, so we must migrate to it.

Change-Id: I805f0bfd491b498434fe57df25154f8aa57891a8

subject: Changes to share_update
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 32531, 'date': '2020-10-11 13:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-10-11 13:12:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 32531, 'date': '2020-10-11 13:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from TOPIC-BRANCH to (bug/1896533)'}, {'account_id': 32531, 'date': '2020-10-11 14:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from (bug/1896533) to bug/1896533'}, {'account_id': 32531, 'date': '2020-10-11 14:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2020-10-13 20:47:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Dina! Thanks a lot and congrats on you first contribution. I cannot review right now, but I'll be working on it tomorrow afternoon. We might need to add some validation in the forms we have for share update. I need to test that in my environment. On the meantime, could you add a unit test for this?"}, {'account_id': 32531, 'date': '2020-10-26 19:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use Ussuri for Ubuntu

This patch makes ubuntu tests use Ussuri since it is the latest
version available now. The version will be bumped to victoria once
Victoria release is available in Cloud Archive.

Change-Id: I5c196885d4d83b8a29748cc00859915de8b4243f
(cherry picked from commit 594cab64cd4a5ba565aa2304d3360e4ead70908c)
(cherry picked from commit ea5ca8a7e79899eebd4567fc2bda34bf56867de4)

updates network policy doc

updates the documentation about enabling the network policy
support to include the option to set enforce_sg_rules to false.

Change-Id: Ic7247718d7d179e87ea84bbc21a022791091c439
Closes-Bug: #1901097

[{'created': '2020-09-15 06:03:30.000000000', 'message': "pylint: Fix unnecessary-comprehension warning

'unnecessary-comprehension' warning is emitted when
unnecessary use of a comprehension is found.

classes attribute in Action can be a tuple,
so we need list() to ensure it is a list before adding 'disabled'.

but it should be handled separately.

commit_message:
pylint: Fix unnecessary-comprehension warning

'unnecessary-comprehension' warning is emitted when
unnecessary use of a comprehension is found.

classes attribute in Action can be a tuple,
so we need list() to ensure it is a list before adding 'disabled'.
I think it is time to introduce a method in Action class or somewhere
but it should be handled separately.

Change-Id: I16a98d56b6d0bd0af234b00735c6ed576620df7e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-03 12:28:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add validation to verify the RHSM version.

One of the requirements in the upgrade/update to certain versions
is that the RHSM version configure in the node matches the version
OSP works with. If there is a mismatch on the RHSM version, we would
end up getting wrong packages and finish in an unrecoverable situation.

This validation uses the subscription-manager command to get the
configured release and then checks if it matches the one configured
in check_rhsm_version_expected parameter.

Change-Id: I950395ff8387b01d102fee3a53ad269bb73f16fd

commit_message:
Add validation to verify the RHSM version.

One of the requirements in the upgrade/update to certain versions
is that the RHSM version configure in the node matches the version
OSP works with. If there is a mismatch on the RHSM version, we would
end up getting wrong packages and finish in an unrecoverable situation.

This validation uses the subscription-manager command to get the
configured release and then checks if it matches the one configured
in check_rhsm_version_expected parameter.

Change-Id: I950395ff8387b01d102fee3a53ad269bb73f16fd

[{'created': '2020-10-24 10:49:01.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize container_cli usage by mysql-open-files-limit validation

mysql-open-files-limit could fail because Ansible fails to obtain
container_cli definition from inventory.

There are multiple playbooks that use container_cli to run
various commands. All playbooks but mysql-open-files-limit define
container_cli in different way. This patch aligns container_cli
definition and usage for mysql-open-files-limit validation with

Related: rhbz#1891202
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize container_cli usage by mysql-open-files-limit validation

mysql-open-files-limit could fail because Ansible fails to obtain
container_cli definition from inventory.

There are multiple playbooks that use container_cli to run
various commands. All playbooks but mysql-open-files-limit define
container_cli in different way. This patch aligns container_cli
definition and usage for mysql-open-files-limit validation with
other validations.

Change-Id: Ie957b9bb046e006be0e5cc56bd749a2fe67178e8
Closes-Bug: #1901299
Related: rhbz#1891202

commit_message:
Refactor vif plugging validations

It makes no sense to lump vif_plugging_timeout and vif_plugging_fatal
into the same tasks. One is a numeric value validated to be larger
than a minimum, the other is a boolean value validated to be set to
True. Split them into separate tasks, and clarify the failure error
messages.

Closes-Bug: #1901297
Related: rhbz#1891197

Change-Id: I7a28f6014c55293d018d5fbc3223a26a10550f1c
(cherry picked from commit ee19a57bc58fc8cbfa6ec761fba383a1bfaa48b0)

commit_message:
Fix wrong notification between api service and httpd

nova-api service should be stopped before httpd service is started,
thus nova-api should notify httpd.

Change-Id: Ibffb65269daaeca62554cfbecb536361ab70611a
(cherry picked from commit 1f1428e01b81c773b772b850232f910a0fc18aad)

commit_message:
Include nova::workarounds for all nova services

nova::workarounds is used for config options in the [workarounds] section in
nova.conf.
Right now it is just included for the conductor and compute services as the
two existing params only apply to these services.
However workaround config params can apply to any or all nova services so it
should be included for all services.

Change-Id: Ie27fb87f1446d1570e0eb7608812ddfa70b7f91f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-23 13:04:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix database migrations with SQLAlchemy 1.3.20

The pattern of adding a column and then reading a table with it
no longer works. I intend on reporting it upstream, but let's work
around the problem for now by using higher-level Table object.

Change-Id: I2fb07413e8f421f39b24acf1272771ee2097b195
"}, {'created': '2020-10-26 13:17:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix database migrations and disable the non-standalone job

The pattern of adding a column and then reading a table with it
no longer works in SQLAlchemy 1.3.20. This has been reported
upstream [1] and apparently we're doing the wrong thing by reusing
a column object twice.

We need to disable the non-standalone job since it's really broken
now, and this fix is blocking bifrost.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/5669

Change-Id: I2fb07413e8f421f39b24acf1272771ee2097b195
"}]
commit_message:
Fix database migrations and disable the non-standalone job

The pattern of adding a column and then reading a table with it
no longer works in SQLAlchemy 1.3.20. This has been reported
upstream [1] and apparently we're doing the wrong thing by reusing
a column object twice.

We need to disable the non-standalone job since it's really broken
now, and this fix is blocking bifrost.

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/5669

Change-Id: I2fb07413e8f421f39b24acf1272771ee2097b195

Added tempest ironic resources setup.

Tempest ironic resources setup part was missing.
It causes multiple test failures in the tempest run.

Change-Id: Ie0441485daec81fbb7e5593097cfb7a96eec9853

commit_message:
Add agent/explicitly_egress_direct support

This configuration parameter for the ML2/OVS agent was added in
I14fefe289a19b718b247bf0740ca9bc47f8903f4 and backported up to
stable/queens, preventing flooding on integration bridge in some cases.

It needs to be enabled on specific node types, so add option to
configure it.

Conflicts:
	manifests/agents/ml2/ovs.pp
	spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb

Related-Bug: #1732067
Change-Id: Iff50d2d086c687ef9ec1ba878e24c06dfc8a7d99
(cherry picked from commit d0bc82d8427c43dac07a8118d2fe35ba5a9d9dce)

commit_message:
Use the utility host for db setup tasks

Move it to the service setup host (defaults to utility[0]) instead
of the galera[0] host, and use galera_address (defaults to internal VIP)
as the endpoint instead of a local connection on the db host.

Change-Id: Id0763b9e95f3b12127aa5a2b5663b6a53429f4a3

subject: Add package install for openssl-perl
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9914, 'name': 'Ade Lee', 'email': 'alee@redhat.com', 'username': 'alee'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-09-03 19:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-09-03 19:25:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-09-09 07:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-09-09 07:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

But one question though. Please see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/749829/1 : "The ipaclient role from ansible-freeipa ensures the dependencies it
needs are installed"

so shouldn't that role ensure openssl-perl as well?'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-09-16 13:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-09-16 14:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The ipaclient role has nothing to do with /etc/pki/CA, and so, does not require it.  This location is used by tripleo-heat-templates to store certificates it gets issued during the install process.  In our templates, we tell it to use directories under /etc/pki/CA'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-21 20:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-22 14:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-22 20:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-23 03:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-10-23 13:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think this package should be added to the IPA role not as an extra task in tht.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-23 14:21:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Kevin, 

The ipaclient role that is invoked in this case is the system role (ansible-freeipa), rather than tripleo-ipa.  That role deals with all things ipaclient and nothing tripleo specific.

ipaclient does not use the /etc/pki/CA directory to store certificates.  It stores what it needs under /etc/ipa.  Tripleo, on the other hand, does care about /etc/pki/CA, because this is where we have chosen to store the certificates for all the services.  So, tripleo is the one that knows that it wants /etc/pki/CA and whether or not the operator has indicated that we're in some kind of air-gapped environment.  It should be the one that installs the package."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-23 14:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-10-23 14:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-10-23 15:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-10-23 15:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Holding back +2 for now'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-10-23 15:06:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-23 15:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-10-23 18:40:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Turns out we already did this on the undercloud because RHEL8.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1821139

I think it would be better to fix the locations where we're requesting stuff (e.g. use /etc/pki/tls) instead of adding this but in the mean time, i guess this could be done"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-10-23 18:49:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-10-26 15:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ussuri as commit bf50c743a3bf9d126185d1044d3ad3f7b139ac5d'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-03 19:25:00.000000000', 'message': "Add package install for openssl-perl

openssl-perl is used to get the directory /etc/pki/CA, which
is needed for cert requests during the deployment.  In OVB
deployments, this package is part of the image and so does not need
to be installed.

In pre-provisioned node environments, we need to document that this
package needs to be installed.  By adding this patch, we ensure that
it is there before we need it for certs.

This of course assumes we're not in some kind of airgapped environment
(which is why its dependent on IdMInstallClientPackages).  In that case,
we need to continue to doc what must be there.

commit_message:
Add package install for openssl-perl

openssl-perl is used to get the directory /etc/pki/CA, which
is needed for cert requests during the deployment.  In OVB
deployments, this package is part of the image and so does not need
to be installed.

In pre-provisioned node environments, we need to document that this
package needs to be installed.  By adding this patch, we ensure that
it is there before we need it for certs.

This of course assumes we're not in some kind of airgapped environment
(which is why its dependent on IdMInstallClientPackages).  In that case,
we need to continue to doc what must be there.

Change-Id: I7fe5404144f7a75a5a1c257ceef9593719ac5dbc

commit_message:
Disable keystone service/endpoint for ceilometer

Since ceilometer-api has been removed, we no longer need ceilometer
service and endpoints registered to keystone.

Change-Id: I4d8a067c02e9dc4152c7606c2865ebb9768c2fa0

commit_message:
Re-adding redhat-7.yml distro var

Some periodic jobs on tripleo that still run centos-7 jobs for other
branches require this variable.
This file was removed by 5a46aff857c72fb8eb5613b67de74de40219ef73
Also adding a centos-7 standalone job for coverage.

Change-Id: I85b2841591990fc91ec665b8f77e4ceb50766c6c
Closes-Bug: #1900443

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-30 09:06:54.000000000', 'message': 'hyperv: Configures chassis asset tags for VMs.

The Msvm_VirtualSystemSettingData object associated with a VM has a
field named "ChassisAssetTag". The value set in this field is reflected
in Linux VMs in /sys/class/dmi/id/chassis-asset-tag. This value is
checked by cloud-init in order to figure out if it is currently running
inside an OpenStack VM.

The verification above has been introduced in cloud-init [1] in order to
avoid costly metadata probes that aren't needed in non-OpenStack VMs.

Setting the ChassisAssetTag will allow us to pass these checks. The
value we are setting is similar to what libvirt is setting in the
LibvirtConfigGuestSysinfo.

[1] https://github.com/canonical/cloud-init/commit/1efa8a0a030794cec68197100f31a856d0d264ab

Partially-Fixes: #1895976

Change-Id: Ib9f605f68c79ff41d3959c7a1662a9e644fde946
Depends-On: 33e6c07dab4b46442bf0fbb838d59516112899b9
'}, {'created': '2020-10-26 11:21:40.000000000', 'message': 'hyperv: Configures chassis asset tags for VMs.

The Msvm_VirtualSystemSettingData object associated with a VM has a
field named "ChassisAssetTag". The value set in this field is reflected
in Linux VMs in /sys/class/dmi/id/chassis-asset-tag. This value is
checked by cloud-init in order to figure out if it is currently running
inside an OpenStack VM.

The verification above has been introduced in cloud-init [1] in order to
avoid costly metadata probes that aren't needed in non-OpenStack VMs.

Setting the ChassisAssetTag will allow us to pass these checks. The
value we are setting is similar to what libvirt is setting in the
LibvirtConfigGuestSysinfo.

[1] https://github.com/canonical/cloud-init/commit/1efa8a0a030794cec68197100f31a856d0d264ab

Partially-Fixes: #1895976

Change-Id: Ib9f605f68c79ff41d3959c7a1662a9e644fde946
Depends-On: 33e6c07dab4b46442bf0fbb838d59516112899b9
'}]
commit_message:
hyperv: Configures chassis asset tags for VMs.

The Msvm_VirtualSystemSettingData object associated with a VM has a
field named "ChassisAssetTag". The value set in this field is reflected
in Linux VMs in /sys/class/dmi/id/chassis-asset-tag. This value is
checked by cloud-init in order to figure out if it is currently running
inside an OpenStack VM.

The verification above has been introduced in cloud-init [1] in order to
avoid costly metadata probes that aren't needed in non-OpenStack VMs.

Setting the ChassisAssetTag will allow us to pass these checks. The
value we are setting is similar to what libvirt is setting in the
LibvirtConfigGuestSysinfo.

[1] https://github.com/canonical/cloud-init/commit/1efa8a0a030794cec68197100f31a856d0d264ab

Partially-Fixes: #1895976

Change-Id: Ib9f605f68c79ff41d3959c7a1662a9e644fde946
Depends-On: 33e6c07dab4b46442bf0fbb838d59516112899b9

commit_message:
Use Ussuri for Ubuntu

This patch makes ubuntu tests use Ussuri since it is the latest
version available now. The version will be bumped to victoria once
Victoria release is available in Cloud Archive.

Change-Id: I5c196885d4d83b8a29748cc00859915de8b4243f
(cherry picked from commit 594cab64cd4a5ba565aa2304d3360e4ead70908c)

commit_message:
Fix load balancers with failed amphora failover

There was a bug in the load balancer failover code for the amphora
v1 driver where if there were multiple failed amphora, with session
persistence, could cause a load balancer failover to not complete.

Change-Id: Ia46a05ab9fdc97ed9be699e5b2ae90daca3ab9a2
Story: 2008099
Task: 40802
(cherry picked from commit 77dc23fc26cbb8c6488b5205c63bf7cc847a9c32)
